Text: Nature, in the broadest sense, is the natural, physical, material world or universe.
text_pp: Nature in the broadest sense is the natural physical material world or universe

Text: "Nature" can refer to the phenomena of the physical world, and also to life in general.
text_pp: Nature can refer to the phenomena of the physical world and also to life in general

Text: The study of nature is a large, if not the only, part of science.
text_pp: The study of nature is a large if not the only part of science

Text: Although humans are part of nature, human activity is often understood as a separate category from other natural phenomena.
text_pp: Although humans are part of nature human activity is often understood as a separate category from other natural phenomena

Text: [1] The word nature is borrowed from the Old French nature and is derived from the Latin word natura, or "essential qualities, innate disposition", and in ancient times, literally meant "birth".
text_pp: The word nature is borrowed from the Old French nature and is derived from the Latin word natura or essential qualities innate disposition and in ancient times literally meant birth

Text: [2] In ancient philosophy, natura is mostly used as the Latin translation of the Greek word physis (φύσις), which originally related to the intrinsic characteristics that plants, animals, and other features of the world develop of their own accord.
text_pp: In ancient philosophy natura is mostly used as the Latin translation of the Greek word physis  which originally related to the intrinsic characteristics that plants animals and other features of the world develop of their own accord

Text:
[3][4] 
The concept of nature as a whole, the physical universe, is one of several expansions of the original notion;[1] it began with certain core applications of the word φύσις by pre-Socratic philosophers (though this word had a dynamic dimension then, especially for Heraclitus), and has steadily gained currency ever since.
text_pp: The concept of nature as a whole the physical universe is one of several expansions of the original notion it began with certain core applications of the word by preSocratic philosophers though this word had a dynamic dimension then especially for Heraclitus and has steadily gained currency ever since

Text: During the advent of modern scientific method in the last several centuries, nature became the passive reality, organized and moved by divine laws.
text_pp: During the advent of modern scientific method in the last several centuries nature became the passive reality organized and moved by divine laws

Text: [5][6] With the Industrial revolution, nature increasingly became seen as the part of reality deprived from intentional intervention : it was hence considered as sacred by some traditions (Rousseau, American transcendentalism) or a mere decorum for divine providence or human history (Hegel, Marx).
text_pp: With the Industrial revolution nature increasingly became seen as the part of reality deprived from intentional intervention it was hence considered as sacred by some traditions Rousseau American transcendentalism or a mere decorum for divine providence or human history Hegel Marx

Text: However, a vitalist vision of nature, closer to the presocratic one, got reborn at the same time, especially after Charles Darwin.
text_pp: However a vitalist vision of nature closer to the presocratic one got reborn at the same time especially after Charles Darwin

Text: [1] Within the various uses of the word today, "nature" often refers to geology and wildlife.
text_pp: Within the various uses of the word today nature often refers to geology and wildlife

Text: Nature can refer to the general realm of living plants and animals, and in some cases to the processes associated with inanimate objects—the way that particular types of things exist and change of their own accord, such as the weather and geology of the Earth.
text_pp: Nature can refer to the general realm of living plants and animals and in some cases to the processes associated with inanimate objects way that particular types of things exist and change of their own accord such as the weather and geology of the Earth

Text: It is often taken to mean the "natural environment" or wilderness—wild animals, rocks, forest, and in general those things that have not been substantially altered by human intervention, or which persist despite human intervention.
text_pp: It is often taken to mean the natural environment or wilderness animals rocks forest and in general those things that have not been substantially altered by human intervention or which persist despite human intervention

Text: For example, manufactured objects and human interaction generally are not considered part of nature, unless qualified as, for example, "human nature" or "the whole of nature".
text_pp: For example manufactured objects and human interaction generally are not considered part of nature unless qualified as for example human nature or the whole of nature

Text: This more traditional concept of natural things that can still be found today implies a distinction between the natural and the artificial, with the artificial being understood as that which has been brought into being by a human consciousness or a human mind.
text_pp: This more traditional concept of natural things that can still be found today implies a distinction between the natural and the artificial with the artificial being understood as that which has been brought into being by a human consciousness or a human mind

Text: Depending on the particular context, the term "natural" might also be distinguished from the unnatural or the supernatural.
text_pp: Depending on the particular context the term natural might also be distinguished from the unnatural or the supernatural

Text: [1] Earth is the only planet known to support life, and its natural features are the subject of many fields of scientific research.
text_pp: Earth is the only planet known to support life and its natural features are the subject of many fields of scientific research

Text: Within the solar system, it is third closest to the sun; it is the largest terrestrial planet and the fifth largest overall.
text_pp: Within the solar system it is third closest to the sun it is the largest terrestrial planet and the fifth largest overall

Text: Its most prominent climatic features are its two large polar regions, two relatively narrow temperate zones, and a wide equatorial tropical to subtropical region.
text_pp: Its most prominent climatic features are its two large polar regions two relatively narrow temperate zones and a wide equatorial tropical to subtropical region

Text: [7] Precipitation varies widely with location, from several metres of water per year to less than a millimetre.
text_pp: Precipitation varies widely with location from several metres of water per year to less than a millimetre

Text: 71 percent of the Earth's surface is covered by salt-water oceans.
text_pp: percent of the Earth surface is covered by saltwater oceans

Text: The remainder consists of continents and islands, with most of the inhabited land in the Northern Hemisphere.
text_pp: The remainder consists of continents and islands with most of the inhabited land in the Northern Hemisphere

Text: Earth has evolved through geological and biological processes that have left traces of the original conditions.
text_pp: Earth has evolved through geological and biological processes that have left traces of the original conditions

Text: The outer surface is divided into several gradually migrating tectonic plates.
text_pp: The outer surface is divided into several gradually migrating tectonic plates

Text: The interior remains active, with a thick layer of plastic mantle and an iron-filled core that generates a magnetic field.
text_pp: The interior remains active with a thick layer of plastic mantle and an ironfilled core that generates a magnetic field

Text: This iron core is composed of a solid inner phase, and a fluid outer phase.
text_pp: This iron core is composed of a solid inner phase and a fluid outer phase

Text: Convective motion in the core generates electric currents through dynamo action, and these, in turn, generate the geomagnetic field.
text_pp: Convective motion in the core generates electric currents through dynamo action and these in turn generate the geomagnetic field

Text: The atmospheric conditions have been significantly altered from the original conditions by the presence of life-forms,[8] which create an ecological balance that stabilizes the surface conditions.
text_pp: The atmospheric conditions have been significantly altered from the original conditions by the presence of lifeforms which create an ecological balance that stabilizes the surface conditions

Text: Despite the wide regional variations in climate by latitude and other geographic factors, the long-term average global climate is quite stable during interglacial periods,[9] and variations of a degree or two of average global temperature have historically had major effects on the ecological balance, and on the actual geography of the Earth.
text_pp: Despite the wide regional variations in climate by latitude and other geographic factors the longterm average global climate is quite stable during interglacial periods and variations of a degree or two of average global temperature have historically had major effects on the ecological balance and on the actual geography of the Earth

Text: [10][11] Geology is the science and study of the solid and liquid matter that constitutes the earth.
text_pp: Geology is the science and study of the solid and liquid matter that constitutes the earth

Text: The field of geology encompasses the study of the composition, structure, physical properties, dynamics, and history of Earth materials, and the processes by which they are formed, moved, and changed.
text_pp: The field of geology encompasses the study of the composition structure physical properties dynamics and history of Earth materials and the processes by which they are formed moved and changed

Text: The field is a major academic discipline, and is also important for mineral and hydrocarbon extraction, knowledge about and mitigation of natural hazards, some Geotechnical engineering fields, and understanding past climates and environments.
text_pp: The field is a major academic discipline and is also important for mineral and hydrocarbon extraction knowledge about and mitigation of natural hazards some Geotechnical engineering fields and understanding past climates and environments

Text: The geology of an area evolves through time as rock units are deposited and inserted and deformational processes change their shapes and locations.
text_pp: The geology of an area evolves through time as rock units are deposited and inserted and deformational processes change their shapes and locations

Text: Rock units are first emplaced either by deposition onto the surface or intrude into the overlying rock.
text_pp: Rock units are first emplaced either by deposition onto the surface or intrude into the overlying rock

Text: Deposition can occur when sediments settle onto the surface of the Earth and later lithify into sedimentary rock, or when as volcanic material such as volcanic ash or lava flows, blanket the surface.
text_pp: Deposition can occur when sediments settle onto the surface of the Earth and later lithify into sedimentary rock or when as volcanic material such as volcanic ash or lava flows blanket the surface

Text: Igneous intrusions such as batholiths, laccoliths, dikes, and sills, push upwards into the overlying rock, and crystallize as they intrude.
text_pp: Igneous intrusions such as batholiths laccoliths dikes and sills push upwards into the overlying rock and crystallize as they intrude

Text: After the initial sequence of rocks has been deposited, the rock units can be deformed and/or metamorphosed.
text_pp: After the initial sequence of rocks has been deposited the rock units can be deformed andor metamorphosed

Text: Deformation typically occurs as a result of horizontal shortening, horizontal extension, or side-to-side (strike-slip) motion.
text_pp: Deformation typically occurs as a result of horizontal shortening horizontal extension or sidetoside strikeslip motion

Text: These structural regimes broadly relate to convergent boundaries, divergent boundaries, and transform boundaries, respectively, between tectonic plates.
text_pp: These structural regimes broadly relate to convergent boundaries divergent boundaries and transform boundaries respectively between tectonic plates

Text: Earth is estimated to have formed 4.54 billion years ago from the solar nebula, along with the Sun and other planets.
text_pp: Earth is estimated to have formed billion years ago from the solar nebula along with the Sun and other planets

Text: [12] The moon formed roughly 20 million years later.
text_pp: The moon formed roughly million years later

Text: Initially molten, the outer layer of the Earth cooled, resulting in the solid crust.
text_pp: Initially molten the outer layer of the Earth cooled resulting in the solid crust

Text: Outgassing and volcanic activity produced the primordial atmosphere.
text_pp: Outgassing and volcanic activity produced the primordial atmosphere

Text: Condensing water vapor, most or all of which came from ice delivered by comets, produced the oceans and other water sources.
text_pp: Condensing water vapor most or all of which came from ice delivered by comets produced the oceans and other water sources

Text: [13] The highly energetic chemistry is believed to have produced a self-replicating molecule around 4 billion years ago.
text_pp: The highly energetic chemistry is believed to have produced a selfreplicating molecule around billion years ago

Text: [14] Continents formed, then broke up and reformed as the surface of Earth reshaped over hundreds of millions of years, occasionally combining to make a supercontinent.
text_pp: Continents formed then broke up and reformed as the surface of Earth reshaped over hundreds of millions of years occasionally combining to make a supercontinent

Text: Roughly 750 million years ago, the earliest known supercontinent Rodinia, began to break apart.
text_pp: Roughly million years ago the earliest known supercontinent Rodinia began to break apart

Text: The continents later recombined to form Pannotia which broke apart about 540 million years ago, then finally Pangaea, which broke apart about 180 million years ago.
text_pp: The continents later recombined to form Pannotia which broke apart about million years ago then finally Pangaea which broke apart about million years ago

Text: [16] During the Neoproterozoic era, freezing temperatures covered much of the Earth in glaciers and ice sheets.
text_pp: During the Neoproterozoic era freezing temperatures covered much of the Earth in glaciers and ice sheets

Text: This hypothesis has been termed the "Snowball Earth", and it is of particular interest as it precedes the Cambrian explosion in which multicellular life forms began to proliferate about 530–540 million years ago.
text_pp: This hypothesis has been termed the Snowball Earth and it is of particular interest as it precedes the Cambrian explosion in which multicellular life forms began to proliferate about million years ago

Text: [17] Since the Cambrian explosion there have been five distinctly identifiable mass extinctions.
text_pp: Since the Cambrian explosion there have been five distinctly identifiable mass extinctions

Text: [18] The last mass extinction occurred some 66 million years ago, when a meteorite collision probably triggered the extinction of the non-avian dinosaurs and other large reptiles, but spared small animals such as mammals.
text_pp: The last mass extinction occurred some million years ago when a meteorite collision probably triggered the extinction of the nonavian dinosaurs and other large reptiles but spared small animals such as mammals

Text: Over the past 66 million years, mammalian life diversified.
text_pp: Over the past million years mammalian life diversified

Text: [19] Several million years ago, a species of small African ape gained the ability to stand upright.
text_pp: Several million years ago a species of small African ape gained the ability to stand upright

Text: [15] The subsequent advent of human life, and the development of agriculture and further civilization allowed humans to affect the Earth more rapidly than any previous life form, affecting both the nature and quantity of other organisms as well as global climate.
text_pp: The subsequent advent of human life and the development of agriculture and further civilization allowed humans to affect the Earth more rapidly than any previous life form affecting both the nature and quantity of other organisms as well as global climate

Text: By comparison, the Great Oxygenation Event, produced by the proliferation of algae during the Siderian period, required about 300 million years to culminate.
text_pp: By comparison the Great Oxygenation Event produced by the proliferation of algae during the Siderian period required about million years to culminate

Text: The present era is classified as part of a mass extinction event, the Holocene extinction event, the fastest ever to have occurred.
text_pp: The present era is classified as part of a mass extinction event the Holocene extinction event the fastest ever to have occurred

Text: [20][21] Some, such as E. O. Wilson of Harvard University, predict that human destruction of the biosphere could cause the extinction of one-half of all species in the next 100 years.
text_pp: Some such as E O Wilson of Harvard University predict that human destruction of the biosphere could cause the extinction of onehalf of all species in the next years

Text: [22] The extent of the current extinction event is still being researched, debated and calculated by biologists.
text_pp: The extent of the current extinction event is still being researched debated and calculated by biologists

Text: [23][24][25] The Earth's atmosphere is a key factor in sustaining the ecosystem.
text_pp: The Earth atmosphere is a key factor in sustaining the ecosystem

Text: The thin layer of gases that envelops the Earth is held in place by gravity.
text_pp: The thin layer of gases that envelops the Earth is held in place by gravity

Text: Air is mostly nitrogen, oxygen, water vapor, with much smaller amounts of carbon dioxide, argon, etc.
text_pp: Air is mostly nitrogen oxygen water vapor with much smaller amounts of carbon dioxide argon etc

Text: The atmospheric pressure declines steadily with altitude.
text_pp: The atmospheric pressure declines steadily with altitude

Text: The ozone layer plays an important role in depleting the amount of ultraviolet (UV) radiation that reaches the surface.
text_pp: The ozone layer plays an important role in depleting the amount of ultraviolet UV radiation that reaches the surface

Text: As DNA is readily damaged by UV light, this serves to protect life at the surface.
text_pp: As DNA is readily damaged by UV light this serves to protect life at the surface

Text: The atmosphere also retains heat during the night, thereby reducing the daily temperature extremes.
text_pp: The atmosphere also retains heat during the night thereby reducing the daily temperature extremes

Text: Terrestrial weather occurs almost exclusively in the lower part of the atmosphere, and serves as a convective system for redistributing heat.
text_pp: Terrestrial weather occurs almost exclusively in the lower part of the atmosphere and serves as a convective system for redistributing heat

Text: [26] Ocean currents are another important factor in determining climate, particularly the major underwater thermohaline circulation which distributes heat energy from the equatorial oceans to the polar regions.
text_pp: Ocean currents are another important factor in determining climate particularly the major underwater thermohaline circulation which distributes heat energy from the equatorial oceans to the polar regions

Text: These currents help to moderate the differences in temperature between winter and summer in the temperate zones.
text_pp: These currents help to moderate the differences in temperature between winter and summer in the temperate zones

Text: Also, without the redistributions of heat energy by the ocean currents and atmosphere, the tropics would be much hotter, and the polar regions much colder.
text_pp: Also without the redistributions of heat energy by the ocean currents and atmosphere the tropics would be much hotter and the polar regions much colder

Text: Weather can have both beneficial and harmful effects.
text_pp: Weather can have both beneficial and harmful effects

Text: Extremes in weather, such as tornadoes or hurricanes and cyclones, can expend large amounts of energy along their paths, and produce devastation.
text_pp: Extremes in weather such as tornadoes or hurricanes and cyclones can expend large amounts of energy along their paths and produce devastation

Text: Surface vegetation has evolved a dependence on the seasonal variation of the weather, and sudden changes lasting only a few years can have a dramatic effect, both on the vegetation and on the animals which depend on its growth for their food.
text_pp: Surface vegetation has evolved a dependence on the seasonal variation of the weather and sudden changes lasting only a few years can have a dramatic effect both on the vegetation and on the animals which depend on its growth for their food

Text: Climate is a measure of the long-term trends in the weather.
text_pp: Climate is a measure of the longterm trends in the weather

Text: Various factors are known to influence the climate, including ocean currents, surface albedo, greenhouse gases, variations in the solar luminosity, and changes to the Earth's orbit.
text_pp: Various factors are known to influence the climate including ocean currents surface albedo greenhouse gases variations in the solar luminosity and changes to the Earth orbit

Text: Based on historical records, the Earth is known to have undergone drastic climate changes in the past, including ice ages.
text_pp: Based on historical records the Earth is known to have undergone drastic climate changes in the past including ice ages

Text: The climate of a region depends on a number of factors, especially latitude.
text_pp: The climate of a region depends on a number of factors especially latitude

Text: A latitudinal band of the surface with similar climatic attributes forms a climate region.
text_pp: A latitudinal band of the surface with similar climatic attributes forms a climate region

Text: There are a number of such regions, ranging from the tropical climate at the equator to the polar climate in the northern and southern extremes.
text_pp: There are a number of such regions ranging from the tropical climate at the equator to the polar climate in the northern and southern extremes

Text: Weather is also influenced by the seasons, which result from the Earth's axis being tilted relative to its orbital plane.
text_pp: Weather is also influenced by the seasons which result from the Earth axis being tilted relative to its orbital plane

Text: Thus, at any given time during the summer or winter, one part of the Earth is more directly exposed to the rays of the sun.
text_pp: Thus at any given time during the summer or winter one part of the Earth is more directly exposed to the rays of the sun

Text: This exposure alternates as the Earth revolves in its orbit.
text_pp: This exposure alternates as the Earth revolves in its orbit

Text: At any given time, regardless of season, the northern and southern hemispheres experience opposite seasons.
text_pp: At any given time regardless of season the northern and southern hemispheres experience opposite seasons

Text: Weather is a chaotic system that is readily modified by small changes to the environment, so accurate weather forecasting is limited to only a few days.
text_pp: Weather is a chaotic system that is readily modified by small changes to the environment so accurate weather forecasting is limited to only a few days

Text: [27] Overall, two things are happening worldwide: (1) temperature is increasing on the average; and (2) regional climates have been undergoing noticeable changes.
text_pp: Overall two things are happening worldwide  temperature is increasing on the average and  regional climates have been undergoing noticeable changes

Text: [28] Water is a chemical substance that is composed of hydrogen and oxygen (H2O) and is vital for all known forms of life.
text_pp: Water is a chemical substance that is composed of hydrogen and oxygen HO and is vital for all known forms of life

Text: [29] In typical usage, water refers only to its liquid form or state, but the substance also has a solid state, ice, and a gaseous state, water vapor, or steam.
text_pp: In typical usage water refers only to its liquid form or state but the substance also has a solid state ice and a gaseous state water vapor or steam

Text: Water covers 71% of the Earth's surface.
text_pp: Water covers  of the Earth surface

Text: [30] On Earth, it is found mostly in oceans and other large bodies of water, with 1.6% of water below ground in aquifers and 0.001% in the air as vapor, clouds, and precipitation.
text_pp: On Earth it is found mostly in oceans and other large bodies of water with  of water below ground in aquifers and  in the air as vapor clouds and precipitation

Text: [31][32] Oceans hold 97% of surface water, glaciers, and polar ice caps 2.4%, and other land surface water such as rivers, lakes, and ponds 0.6%.
text_pp: Oceans hold  of surface water glaciers and polar ice caps  and other land surface water such as rivers lakes and ponds

Text: Additionally, a minute amount of the Earth's water is contained within biological bodies and manufactured products.
text_pp: Additionally a minute amount of the Earth water is contained within biological bodies and manufactured products

Text: An ocean is a major body of saline water, and a principal component of the hydrosphere.
text_pp: An ocean is a major body of saline water and a principal component of the hydrosphere

Text: Approximately 71% of the Earth's surface (an area of some 361 million square kilometers) is covered by ocean, a continuous body of water that is customarily divided into several principal oceans and smaller seas.
text_pp: Approximately  of the Earth surface an area of some million square kilometers is covered by ocean a continuous body of water that is customarily divided into several principal oceans and smaller seas

Text: More than half of this area is over 3,000 meters (9,800 feet) deep.
text_pp: More than half of this area is over  meters  feet deep

Text: Average oceanic salinity is around 35 parts per thousand (ppt) (3.5%), and nearly all seawater has a salinity in the range of 30 to 38 ppt.
text_pp: Average oceanic salinity is around parts per thousand ppt  and nearly all seawater has a salinity in the range of to ppt

Text: Though generally recognized as several 'separate' oceans, these waters comprise one global, interconnected body of salt water often referred to as the World Ocean or global ocean.
text_pp: Though generally recognized as several oceans these waters comprise one global interconnected body of salt water often referred to as the World Ocean or global ocean

Text: [33][34] This concept of a global ocean as a continuous body of water with relatively free interchange among its parts is of fundamental importance to oceanography.
text_pp: This concept of a global ocean as a continuous body of water with relatively free interchange among its parts is of fundamental importance to oceanography

Text: [35] The major oceanic divisions are defined in part by the continents, various archipelagos, and other criteria: these divisions are (in descending order of size) the Pacific Ocean, the Atlantic Ocean, the Indian Ocean, the Southern Ocean, and the Arctic Ocean.
text_pp: The major oceanic divisions are defined in part by the continents various archipelagos and other criteria these divisions are in descending order of size the Pacific Ocean the Atlantic Ocean the Indian Ocean the Southern Ocean and the Arctic Ocean

Text: Smaller regions of the oceans are called seas, gulfs, bays and other names.
text_pp: Smaller regions of the oceans are called seas gulfs bays and other names

Text: There are also salt lakes, which are smaller bodies of landlocked saltwater that are not interconnected with the World Ocean.
text_pp: There are also salt lakes which are smaller bodies of landlocked saltwater that are not interconnected with the World Ocean

Text: Two notable examples of salt lakes are the Aral Sea and the Great Salt Lake.
text_pp: Two notable examples of salt lakes are the Aral Sea and the Great Salt Lake

Text: A lake (from Latin word lacus) is a terrain feature (or physical feature), a body of liquid on the surface of a world that is localized to the bottom of basin (another type of landform or terrain feature; that is, it is not global) and moves slowly if it moves at all.
text_pp: A lake from Latin word lacus is a terrain feature or physical feature a body of liquid on the surface of a world that is localized to the bottom of basin another type of landform or terrain feature that is it is not global and moves slowly if it moves at all

Text: On Earth, a body of water is considered a lake when it is inland, not part of the ocean, is larger and deeper than a pond, and is fed by a river.
text_pp: On Earth a body of water is considered a lake when it is inland not part of the ocean is larger and deeper than a pond and is fed by a river

Text: [36][37] The only world other than Earth known to harbor lakes is Titan, Saturn's largest moon, which has lakes of ethane, most likely mixed with methane.
text_pp: The only world other than Earth known to harbor lakes is Titan Saturn largest moon which has lakes of ethane most likely mixed with methane

Text: It is not known if Titan's lakes are fed by rivers, though Titan's surface is carved by numerous river beds.
text_pp: It is not known if Titan lakes are fed by rivers though Titan surface is carved by numerous river beds

Text: Natural lakes on Earth are generally found in mountainous areas, rift zones, and areas with ongoing or recent glaciation.
text_pp: Natural lakes on Earth are generally found in mountainous areas rift zones and areas with ongoing or recent glaciation

Text: Other lakes are found in endorheic basins or along the courses of mature rivers.
text_pp: Other lakes are found in endorheic basins or along the courses of mature rivers

Text: In some parts of the world, there are many lakes because of chaotic drainage patterns left over from the last Ice Age.
text_pp: In some parts of the world there are many lakes because of chaotic drainage patterns left over from the last Ice Age

Text: All lakes are temporary over geologic time scales, as they will slowly fill in with sediments or spill out of the basin containing them.
text_pp: All lakes are temporary over geologic time scales as they will slowly fill in with sediments or spill out of the basin containing them

Text: A pond is a body of standing water, either natural or man-made, that is usually smaller than a lake.
text_pp: A pond is a body of standing water either natural or manmade that is usually smaller than a lake

Text: A wide variety of man-made bodies of water are classified as ponds, including water gardens designed for aesthetic ornamentation, fish ponds designed for commercial fish breeding, and solar ponds designed to store thermal energy.
text_pp: A wide variety of manmade bodies of water are classified as ponds including water gardens designed for aesthetic ornamentation fish ponds designed for commercial fish breeding and solar ponds designed to store thermal energy

Text: Ponds and lakes are distinguished from streams via current speed.
text_pp: Ponds and lakes are distinguished from streams via current speed

Text: While currents in streams are easily observed, ponds and lakes possess thermally driven micro-currents and moderate wind driven currents.
text_pp: While currents in streams are easily observed ponds and lakes possess thermally driven microcurrents and moderate wind driven currents

Text: These features distinguish a pond from many other aquatic terrain features, such as stream pools and tide pools.
text_pp: These features distinguish a pond from many other aquatic terrain features such as stream pools and tide pools

Text: A river is a natural watercourse,[38] usually freshwater, flowing towards an ocean, a lake, a sea or another river.
text_pp: A river is a natural watercourse usually freshwater flowing towards an ocean a lake a sea or another river

Text: In a few cases, a river simply flows into the ground or dries up completely before reaching another body of water.
text_pp: In a few cases a river simply flows into the ground or dries up completely before reaching another body of water

Text: Small rivers may also be called by several other names, including stream, creek, brook, rivulet, and rill; there is no general rule that defines what can be called a river.
text_pp: Small rivers may also be called by several other names including stream creek brook rivulet and rill there is no general rule that defines what can be called a river

Text: Many names for small rivers are specific to geographic location; one example is Burn in Scotland and North-east England.
text_pp: Many names for small rivers are specific to geographic location one example is Burn in Scotland and Northeast England

Text: Sometimes a river is said to be larger than a creek, but this is not always the case, due to vagueness in the language.
text_pp: Sometimes a river is said to be larger than a creek but this is not always the case due to vagueness in the language

Text: [39] A river is part of the hydrological cycle.
text_pp: A river is part of the hydrological cycle

Text: Water within a river is generally collected from precipitation through surface runoff, groundwater recharge, springs, and the release of stored water in natural ice and snowpacks (i.e., from glaciers).
text_pp: Water within a river is generally collected from precipitation through surface runoff groundwater recharge springs and the release of stored water in natural ice and snowpacks ie from glaciers

Text: A stream is a flowing body of water with a current, confined within a bed and stream banks.
text_pp: A stream is a flowing body of water with a current confined within a bed and stream banks

Text: In the United States, a stream is classified as a watercourse less than 60 feet (18 metres) wide.
text_pp: In the United States a stream is classified as a watercourse less than feet  metres wide

Text: Streams are important as conduits in the water cycle, instruments in groundwater recharge, and they serve as corridors for fish and wildlife migration.
text_pp: Streams are important as conduits in the water cycle instruments in groundwater recharge and they serve as corridors for fish and wildlife migration

Text: The biological habitat in the immediate vicinity of a stream is called a riparian zone.
text_pp: The biological habitat in the immediate vicinity of a stream is called a riparian zone

Text: Given the status of the ongoing Holocene extinction, streams play an important corridor role in connecting fragmented habitats and thus in conserving biodiversity.
text_pp: Given the status of the ongoing Holocene extinction streams play an important corridor role in connecting fragmented habitats and thus in conserving biodiversity

Text: The study of streams and waterways in general involves many branches of inter-disciplinary natural science and engineering, including hydrology, fluvial geomorphology, aquatic ecology, fish biology, riparian ecology, and others.
text_pp: The study of streams and waterways in general involves many branches of interdisciplinary natural science and engineering including hydrology fluvial geomorphology aquatic ecology fish biology riparian ecology and others

Text: Ecosystems are composed of a variety of biotic and abiotic components that function in an interrelated way.
text_pp: Ecosystems are composed of a variety of biotic and abiotic components that function in an interrelated way

Text: [41] The structure and composition is determined by various environmental factors that are interrelated.
text_pp: The structure and composition is determined by various environmental factors that are interrelated

Text: Variations of these factors will initiate dynamic modifications to the ecosystem.
text_pp: Variations of these factors will initiate dynamic modifications to the ecosystem

Text: Some of the more important components are soil, atmosphere, radiation from the sun, water, and living organisms.
text_pp: Some of the more important components are soil atmosphere radiation from the sun water and living organisms

Text: Central to the ecosystem concept is the idea that living organisms interact with every other element in their local environment.
text_pp: Central to the ecosystem concept is the idea that living organisms interact with every other element in their local environment

Text: Eugene Odum, a founder of ecology, stated: "Any unit that includes all of the organisms (ie: the "community") in a given area interacting with the physical environment so that a flow of energy leads to clearly defined trophic structure, biotic diversity, and material cycles (i.e.
text_pp: Eugene Odum a founder of ecology stated Any unit that includes all of the organisms ie the community in a given area interacting with the physical environment so that a flow of energy leads to clearly defined trophic structure biotic diversity and material cycles ie

Text: : exchange of materials between living and nonliving parts) within the system is an ecosystem.
text_pp: exchange of materials between living and nonliving parts within the system is an ecosystem

Text: "[42] Within the ecosystem, species are connected and dependent upon one another in the food chain, and exchange energy and matter between themselves as well as with their environment.
text_pp: Within the ecosystem species are connected and dependent upon one another in the food chain and exchange energy and matter between themselves as well as with their environment

Text: [43] The human ecosystem concept is based on the human/nature dichotomy and the idea that all species are ecologically dependent on each other, as well as with the abiotic constituents of their biotope.
text_pp: The human ecosystem concept is based on the humannature dichotomy and the idea that all species are ecologically dependent on each other as well as with the abiotic constituents of their biotope

Text: [44] A smaller unit of size is called a microecosystem.
text_pp: A smaller unit of size is called a microecosystem

Text: For example, a microsystem can be a stone and all the life under it.
text_pp: For example a microsystem can be a stone and all the life under it

Text: A macroecosystem might involve a whole ecoregion, with its drainage basin.
text_pp: A macroecosystem might involve a whole ecoregion with its drainage basin

Text: [45] Wilderness is generally defined as areas that have not been significantly modified by human activity.
text_pp: Wilderness is generally defined as areas that have not been significantly modified by human activity

Text: Wilderness areas can be found in preserves, estates, farms, conservation preserves, ranches, national forests, national parks, and even in urban areas along rivers, gulches, or otherwise undeveloped areas.
text_pp: Wilderness areas can be found in preserves estates farms conservation preserves ranches national forests national parks and even in urban areas along rivers gulches or otherwise undeveloped areas

Text: Wilderness areas and protected parks are considered important for the survival of certain species, ecological studies, conservation, and solitude.
text_pp: Wilderness areas and protected parks are considered important for the survival of certain species ecological studies conservation and solitude

Text: Some nature writers believe wilderness areas are vital for the human spirit and creativity,[46] and some ecologists consider wilderness areas to be an integral part of the Earth's self-sustaining natural ecosystem (the biosphere).
text_pp: Some nature writers believe wilderness areas are vital for the human spirit and creativity and some ecologists consider wilderness areas to be an integral part of the Earth selfsustaining natural ecosystem the biosphere

Text: They may also preserve historic genetic traits and that they provide habitat for wild flora and fauna that may be difficult or impossible to recreate in zoos, arboretums, or laboratories.
text_pp: They may also preserve historic genetic traits and that they provide habitat for wild flora and fauna that may be difficult or impossible to recreate in zoos arboretums or laboratories

Text: Although there is no universal agreement on the definition of life, scientists generally accept that the biological manifestation of life is characterized by organization, metabolism, growth, adaptation, response to stimuli, and reproduction.
text_pp: Although there is no universal agreement on the definition of life scientists generally accept that the biological manifestation of life is characterized by organization metabolism growth adaptation response to stimuli and reproduction

Text: [47] Life may also be said to be simply the characteristic state of organisms.
text_pp: Life may also be said to be simply the characteristic state of organisms

Text: Properties common to terrestrial organisms (plants, animals, fungi, protists, archaea, and bacteria) are that they are cellular, carbon-and-water-based with complex organization, having a metabolism, a capacity to grow, respond to stimuli, and reproduce.
text_pp: Properties common to terrestrial organisms plants animals fungi protists archaea and bacteria are that they are cellular carbonandwaterbased with complex organization having a metabolism a capacity to grow respond to stimuli and reproduce

Text: An entity with these properties is generally considered life.
text_pp: An entity with these properties is generally considered life

Text: However, not every definition of life considers all of these properties to be essential.
text_pp: However not every definition of life considers all of these properties to be essential

Text: Human-made analogs of life may also be considered to be life.
text_pp: Humanmade analogs of life may also be considered to be life

Text: The biosphere is the part of Earth's outer shell—including land, surface rocks, water, air and the atmosphere—within which life occurs, and which biotic processes in turn alter or transform.
text_pp: The biosphere is the part of Earth outer shell land surface rocks water air and the atmosphere which life occurs and which biotic processes in turn alter or transform

Text: From the broadest geophysiological point of view, the biosphere is the global ecological system integrating all living beings and their relationships, including their interaction with the elements of the lithosphere (rocks), hydrosphere (water), and atmosphere (air).
text_pp: From the broadest geophysiological point of view the biosphere is the global ecological system integrating all living beings and their relationships including their interaction with the elements of the lithosphere rocks hydrosphere water and atmosphere air

Text: The entire Earth contains over 75 billion tons (150 trillion pounds or about 6.8×1013 kilograms) of biomass (life), which lives within various environments within the biosphere.
text_pp: The entire Earth contains over billion tons  trillion pounds or about xdkilograms of biomass life which lives within various environments within the biosphere

Text: [48] Over nine-tenths of the total biomass on Earth is plant life, on which animal life depends very heavily for its existence.
text_pp: Over ninetenths of the total biomass on Earth is plant life on which animal life depends very heavily for its existence

Text: [49] More than 2 million species of plant and animal life have been identified to date,[50] and estimates of the actual number of existing species range from several million to well over 50 million.
text_pp: More than million species of plant and animal life have been identified to date and estimates of the actual number of existing species range from several million to well over million

Text: [51][52][53] The number of individual species of life is constantly in some degree of flux, with new species appearing and others ceasing to exist on a continual basis.
text_pp: The number of individual species of life is constantly in some degree of flux with new species appearing and others ceasing to exist on a continual basis

Text: [54][55] The total number of species is in rapid decline.
text_pp: The total number of species is in rapid decline

Text: [56][57][58] The origin of life on Earth is not well understood, but it is known to have occurred at least 3.5 billion years ago,[61][62][63] during the hadean or archean eons on a primordial Earth that had a substantially different environment than is found at present.
text_pp: The origin of life on Earth is not well understood but it is known to have occurred at least billion years ago during the hadean or archean eons on a primordial Earth that had a substantially different environment than is found at present

Text: [64] These life forms possessed the basic traits of self-replication and inheritable traits.
text_pp: These life forms possessed the basic traits of selfreplication and inheritable traits

Text: Once life had appeared, the process of evolution by natural selection resulted in the development of ever-more diverse life forms.
text_pp: Once life had appeared the process of evolution by natural selection resulted in the development of evermore diverse life forms

Text: Species that were unable to adapt to the changing environment and competition from other life forms became extinct.
text_pp: Species that were unable to adapt to the changing environment and competition from other life forms became extinct

Text: However, the fossil record retains evidence of many of these older species.
text_pp: However the fossil record retains evidence of many of these older species

Text: Current fossil and DNA evidence shows that all existing species can trace a continual ancestry back to the first primitive life forms.
text_pp: Current fossil and DNA evidence shows that all existing species can trace a continual ancestry back to the first primitive life forms

Text: [64] When basic forms of plant life developed the process of photosynthesis the sun's energy could be harvested to create conditions which allowed for more complex life forms.
text_pp: When basic forms of plant life developed the process of photosynthesis the sun energy could be harvested to create conditions which allowed for more complex life forms

Text: [65] The resultant oxygen accumulated in the atmosphere and gave rise to the ozone layer.
text_pp: The resultant oxygen accumulated in the atmosphere and gave rise to the ozone layer

Text: The incorporation of smaller cells within larger ones resulted in the development of yet more complex cells called eukaryotes.
text_pp: The incorporation of smaller cells within larger ones resulted in the development of yet more complex cells called eukaryotes

Text: [66] Cells within colonies became increasingly specialized, resulting in true multicellular organisms.
text_pp: Cells within colonies became increasingly specialized resulting in true multicellular organisms

Text: With the ozone layer absorbing harmful ultraviolet radiation, life colonized the surface of Earth.
text_pp: With the ozone layer absorbing harmful ultraviolet radiation life colonized the surface of Earth

Text: The first form of life to develop on the Earth were microbes, and they remained the only form of life until about a billion years ago when multi-cellular organisms began to appear.
text_pp: The first form of life to develop on the Earth were microbes and they remained the only form of life until about a billion years ago when multicellular organisms began to appear

Text: [67] Microorganisms are single-celled organisms that are generally microscopic, and smaller than the human eye can see.
text_pp: Microorganisms are singlecelled organisms that are generally microscopic and smaller than the human eye can see

Text: They include Bacteria, Fungi, Archaea, and Protista.
text_pp: They include Bacteria Fungi Archaea and Protista

Text: These life forms are found in almost every location on the Earth where there is liquid water, including in the Earth's interior.
text_pp: These life forms are found in almost every location on the Earth where there is liquid water including in the Earth interior

Text:
[68]
Their reproduction is both rapid and profuse.
text_pp: Their reproduction is both rapid and profuse

Text: The combination of a high mutation rate and a horizontal gene transfer[69] ability makes them highly adaptable, and able to survive in new environments, including outer space.
text_pp: The combination of a high mutation rate and a horizontal gene transfer ability makes them highly adaptable and able to survive in new environments including outer space

Text: [70] They form an essential part of the planetary ecosystem.
text_pp: They form an essential part of the planetary ecosystem

Text: However, some microorganisms are pathogenic and can post health risk to other organisms.
text_pp: However some microorganisms are pathogenic and can post health risk to other organisms

Text: Originally Aristotle divided all living things between plants, which generally do not move fast enough for humans to notice, and animals.
text_pp: Originally Aristotle divided all living things between plants which generally do not move fast enough for humans to notice and animals

Text: In Linnaeus' system, these became the kingdoms Vegetabilia (later Plantae) and Animalia.
text_pp: In Linnaeus system these became the kingdoms Vegetabilia later Plantae and Animalia

Text: Since then, it has become clear that the Plantae as originally defined included several unrelated groups, and the fungi and several groups of algae were removed to new kingdoms.
text_pp: Since then it has become clear that the Plantae as originally defined included several unrelated groups and the fungi and several groups of algae were removed to new kingdoms

Text: However, these are still often considered plants in many contexts.
text_pp: However these are still often considered plants in many contexts

Text: Bacterial life is sometimes included in flora,[71][72] and some classifications use the term bacterial flora separately from plant flora.
text_pp: Bacterial life is sometimes included in flora and some classifications use the term bacterial flora separately from plant flora

Text: Among the many ways of classifying plants are by regional floras, which, depending on the purpose of study, can also include fossil flora, remnants of plant life from a previous era.
text_pp: Among the many ways of classifying plants are by regional floras which depending on the purpose of study can also include fossil flora remnants of plant life from a previous era

Text: People in many regions and countries take great pride in their individual arrays of characteristic flora, which can vary widely across the globe due to differences in climate and terrain.
text_pp: People in many regions and countries take great pride in their individual arrays of characteristic flora which can vary widely across the globe due to differences in climate and terrain

Text: Regional floras commonly are divided into categories such as native flora and agricultural and garden flora, the lastly mentioned of which are intentionally grown and cultivated.
text_pp: Regional floras commonly are divided into categories such as native flora and agricultural and garden flora the lastly mentioned of which are intentionally grown and cultivated

Text: Some types of "native flora" actually have been introduced centuries ago by people migrating from one region or continent to another, and become an integral part of the native, or natural flora of the place to which they were introduced.
text_pp: Some types of native flora actually have been introduced centuries ago by people migrating from one region or continent to another and become an integral part of the native or natural flora of the place to which they were introduced

Text: This is an example of how human interaction with nature can blur the boundary of what is considered nature.
text_pp: This is an example of how human interaction with nature can blur the boundary of what is considered nature

Text: Another category of plant has historically been carved out for weeds.
text_pp: Another category of plant has historically been carved out for weeds

Text: Though the term has fallen into disfavor among botanists as a formal way to categorize "useless" plants, the informal use of the word "weeds" to describe those plants that are deemed worthy of elimination is illustrative of the general tendency of people and societies to seek to alter or shape the course of nature.
text_pp: Though the term has fallen into disfavor among botanists as a formal way to categorize useless plants the informal use of the word weeds to describe those plants that are deemed worthy of elimination is illustrative of the general tendency of people and societies to seek to alter or shape the course of nature

Text: Similarly, animals are often categorized in ways such as domestic, farm animals, wild animals, pests, etc.
text_pp: Similarly animals are often categorized in ways such as domestic farm animals wild animals pests etc

Text: according to their relationship to human life.
text_pp: according to their relationship to human life

Text: Animals as a category have several characteristics that generally set them apart from other living things.
text_pp: Animals as a category have several characteristics that generally set them apart from other living things

Text: Animals are eukaryotic and usually multicellular (although see Myxozoa), which separates them from bacteria, archaea, and most protists.
text_pp: Animals are eukaryotic and usually multicellular although see Myxozoa which separates them from bacteria archaea and most protists

Text: They are heterotrophic, generally digesting food in an internal chamber, which separates them from plants and algae.
text_pp: They are heterotrophic generally digesting food in an internal chamber which separates them from plants and algae

Text: They are also distinguished from plants, algae, and fungi by lacking cell walls.
text_pp: They are also distinguished from plants algae and fungi by lacking cell walls

Text: With a few exceptions—most notably the two phyla consisting of sponges and placozoans—animals have bodies that are differentiated into tissues.
text_pp: With a few exceptions notably the two phyla consisting of sponges and placozoans have bodies that are differentiated into tissues

Text: These include muscles, which are able to contract and control locomotion, and a nervous system, which sends and processes signals.
text_pp: These include muscles which are able to contract and control locomotion and a nervous system which sends and processes signals

Text: There is also typically an internal digestive chamber.
text_pp: There is also typically an internal digestive chamber

Text: The eukaryotic cells possessed by all animals are surrounded by a characteristic extracellular matrix composed of collagen and elastic glycoproteins.
text_pp: The eukaryotic cells possessed by all animals are surrounded by a characteristic extracellular matrix composed of collagen and elastic glycoproteins

Text: This may be calcified to form structures like shells, bones, and spicules, a framework upon which cells can move about and be reorganized during development and maturation, and which supports the complex anatomy required for mobility.
text_pp: This may be calcified to form structures like shells bones and spicules a framework upon which cells can move about and be reorganized during development and maturation and which supports the complex anatomy required for mobility

Text: Although humans comprise only a minuscule proportion of the total living biomass on Earth, the human effect on nature is disproportionately large.
text_pp: Although humans comprise only a minuscule proportion of the total living biomass on Earth the human effect on nature is disproportionately large

Text: Because of the extent of human influence, the boundaries between what humans regard as nature and "made environments" is not clear cut except at the extremes.
text_pp: Because of the extent of human influence the boundaries between what humans regard as nature and made environments is not clear cut except at the extremes

Text: Even at the extremes, the amount of natural environment that is free of discernible human influence is diminishing at an increasingly rapid pace.
text_pp: Even at the extremes the amount of natural environment that is free of discernible human influence is diminishing at an increasingly rapid pace

Text: The development of technology by the human race has allowed the greater exploitation of natural resources and has helped to alleviate some of the risk from natural hazards.
text_pp: The development of technology by the human race has allowed the greater exploitation of natural resources and has helped to alleviate some of the risk from natural hazards

Text: In spite of this progress, however, the fate of human civilization remains closely linked to changes in the environment.
text_pp: In spite of this progress however the fate of human civilization remains closely linked to changes in the environment

Text: There exists a highly complex feedback loop between the use of advanced technology and changes to the environment that are only slowly becoming understood.
text_pp: There exists a highly complex feedback loop between the use of advanced technology and changes to the environment that are only slowly becoming understood

Text: [73] Man-made threats to the Earth's natural environment include pollution, deforestation, and disasters such as oil spills.
text_pp: Manmade threats to the Earth natural environment include pollution deforestation and disasters such as oil spills

Text: Humans have contributed to the extinction of many plants and animals.
text_pp: Humans have contributed to the extinction of many plants and animals

Text: Humans employ nature for both leisure and economic activities.
text_pp: Humans employ nature for both leisure and economic activities

Text: The acquisition of natural resources for industrial use remains a sizable component of the world's economic system.
text_pp: The acquisition of natural resources for industrial use remains a sizable component of the world economic system

Text: [74][75] Some activities, such as hunting and fishing, are used for both sustenance and leisure, often by different people.
text_pp: Some activities such as hunting and fishing are used for both sustenance and leisure often by different people

Text: Agriculture was first adopted around the 9th millennium BCE.
text_pp: Agriculture was first adopted around the th millennium BCE

Text: Ranging from food production to energy, nature influences economic wealth.
text_pp: Ranging from food production to energy nature influences economic wealth

Text: Although early humans gathered uncultivated plant materials for food and employed the medicinal properties of vegetation for healing,[76] most modern human use of plants is through agriculture.
text_pp: Although early humans gathered uncultivated plant materials for food and employed the medicinal properties of vegetation for healing most modern human use of plants is through agriculture

Text: The clearance of large tracts of land for crop growth has led to a significant reduction in the amount available of forestation and wetlands, resulting in the loss of habitat for many plant and animal species as well as increased erosion.
text_pp: The clearance of large tracts of land for crop growth has led to a significant reduction in the amount available of forestation and wetlands resulting in the loss of habitat for many plant and animal species as well as increased erosion

Text: [77] Beauty in nature has historically been a prevalent theme in art and books, filling large sections of libraries and bookstores.
text_pp: Beauty in nature has historically been a prevalent theme in art and books filling large sections of libraries and bookstores

Text: That nature has been depicted and celebrated by so much art, photography, poetry, and other literature shows the strength with which many people associate nature and beauty.
text_pp: That nature has been depicted and celebrated by so much art photography poetry and other literature shows the strength with which many people associate nature and beauty

Text: Reasons why this association exists, and what the association consists of, are studied by the branch of philosophy called aesthetics.
text_pp: Reasons why this association exists and what the association consists of are studied by the branch of philosophy called aesthetics

Text: Beyond certain basic characteristics that many philosophers agree about to explain what is seen as beautiful, the opinions are virtually endless.
text_pp: Beyond certain basic characteristics that many philosophers agree about to explain what is seen as beautiful the opinions are virtually endless

Text: [78] Nature and wildness have been important subjects in various eras of world history.
text_pp: Nature and wildness have been important subjects in various eras of world history

Text: An early tradition of landscape art began in China during the Tang Dynasty (618–907).
text_pp: An early tradition of landscape art began in China during the Tang Dynasty

Text: The tradition of representing nature as it is became one of the aims of Chinese painting and was a significant influence in Asian art.
text_pp: The tradition of representing nature as it is became one of the aims of Chinese painting and was a significant influence in Asian art

Text: Although natural wonders are celebrated in the Psalms and the Book of Job, wilderness portrayals in art became more prevalent in the 1800s, especially in the works of the Romantic movement.
text_pp: Although natural wonders are celebrated in the Psalms and the Book of Job wilderness portrayals in art became more prevalent in the s especially in the works of the Romantic movement

Text: British artists John Constable and J. M. W. Turner turned their attention to capturing the beauty of the natural world in their paintings.
text_pp: British artists John Constable and J M W Turner turned their attention to capturing the beauty of the natural world in their paintings

Text: Before that, paintings had been primarily of religious scenes or of human beings.
text_pp: Before that paintings had been primarily of religious scenes or of human beings

Text: William Wordsworth's poetry described the wonder of the natural world, which had formerly been viewed as a threatening place.
text_pp: William Wordsworth poetry described the wonder of the natural world which had formerly been viewed as a threatening place

Text: Increasingly the valuing of nature became an aspect of Western culture.
text_pp: Increasingly the valuing of nature became an aspect of Western culture

Text: [79] This artistic movement also coincided with the Transcendentalist movement in the Western world.
text_pp: This artistic movement also coincided with the Transcendentalist movement in the Western world

Text: A common classical idea of beautiful art involves the word mimesis, the imitation of nature.
text_pp: A common classical idea of beautiful art involves the word mimesis the imitation of nature

Text: Also in the realm of ideas about beauty in nature is that the perfect is implied through perfect mathematical forms and more generally by patterns in nature.
text_pp: Also in the realm of ideas about beauty in nature is that the perfect is implied through perfect mathematical forms and more generally by patterns in nature

Text: As David Rothenburg writes, "The beautiful is the root of science and the goal of art, the highest possibility that humanity can ever hope to see".
text_pp: As David Rothenburg writes The beautiful is the root of science and the goal of art the highest possibility that humanity can ever hope to see

Text: [80]:281 Some fields of science see nature as matter in motion, obeying certain laws of nature which science seeks to understand.
text_pp: Some fields of science see nature as matter in motion obeying certain laws of nature which science seeks to understand

Text: For this reason the most fundamental science is generally understood to be "physics"—the name for which is still recognizable as meaning that it is the "study of nature".
text_pp: For this reason the most fundamental science is generally understood to be physics name for which is still recognizable as meaning that it is the study of nature

Text: Matter is commonly defined as the substance of which physical objects are composed.
text_pp: Matter is commonly defined as the substance of which physical objects are composed

Text: It constitutes the observable universe.
text_pp: It constitutes the observable universe

Text: The visible components of the universe are now believed to compose only 4.9 percent of the total mass.
text_pp: The visible components of the universe are now believed to compose only  percent of the total mass

Text: The remainder is believed to consist of 26.8 percent cold dark matter and 68.3 percent dark energy.
text_pp: The remainder is believed to consist of  percent cold dark matter and  percent dark energy

Text: [81] The exact arrangement of these components is still unknown and is under intensive investigation by physicists.
text_pp: The exact arrangement of these components is still unknown and is under intensive investigation by physicists

Text: The behaviour of matter and energy throughout the observable universe appears to follow well-defined physical laws.
text_pp: The behaviour of matter and energy throughout the observable universe appears to follow welldefined physical laws

Text: These laws have been employed to produce cosmological models that successfully explain the structure and the evolution of the universe we can observe.
text_pp: These laws have been employed to produce cosmological models that successfully explain the structure and the evolution of the universe we can observe

Text: The mathematical expressions of the laws of physics employ a set of twenty physical constants[82] that appear to be static across the observable universe.
text_pp: The mathematical expressions of the laws of physics employ a set of twenty physical constants that appear to be static across the observable universe

Text: [83] The values of these constants have been carefully measured, but the reason for their specific values remains a mystery.
text_pp: The values of these constants have been carefully measured but the reason for their specific values remains a mystery

Text: Outer space, also simply called space, refers to the relatively empty regions of the Universe outside the atmospheres of celestial bodies.
text_pp: Outer space also simply called space refers to the relatively empty regions of the Universe outside the atmospheres of celestial bodies

Text: Outer space is used to distinguish it from airspace (and terrestrial locations).
text_pp: Outer space is used to distinguish it from airspace and terrestrial locations

Text: There is no discrete boundary between Earth's atmosphere and space, as the atmosphere gradually attenuates with increasing altitude.
text_pp: There is no discrete boundary between Earth atmosphere and space as the atmosphere gradually attenuates with increasing altitude

Text: Outer space within the Solar System is called interplanetary space, which passes over into interstellar space at what is known as the heliopause.
text_pp: Outer space within the Solar System is called interplanetary space which passes over into interstellar space at what is known as the heliopause

Text: Outer space is sparsely filled with several dozen types of organic molecules discovered to date by microwave spectroscopy, blackbody radiation left over from the Big Bang and the origin of the universe, and cosmic rays, which include ionized atomic nuclei and various subatomic particles.
text_pp: Outer space is sparsely filled with several dozen types of organic molecules discovered to date by microwave spectroscopy blackbody radiation left over from the Big Bang and the origin of the universe and cosmic rays which include ionized atomic nuclei and various subatomic particles

Text: There is also some gas, plasma and dust, and small meteors.
text_pp: There is also some gas plasma and dust and small meteors

Text: Additionally, there are signs of human life in outer space today, such as material left over from previous manned and unmanned launches which are a potential hazard to spacecraft.
text_pp: Additionally there are signs of human life in outer space today such as material left over from previous manned and unmanned launches which are a potential hazard to spacecraft

Text: Some of this debris re-enters the atmosphere periodically.
text_pp: Some of this debris reenters the atmosphere periodically

Text: Although Earth is the only body within the solar system known to support life, evidence suggests that in the distant past the planet Mars possessed bodies of liquid water on the surface.
text_pp: Although Earth is the only body within the solar system known to support life evidence suggests that in the distant past the planet Mars possessed bodies of liquid water on the surface

Text: [84] For a brief period in Mars' history, it may have also been capable of forming life.
text_pp: For a brief period in Mars history it may have also been capable of forming life

Text: At present though, most of the water remaining on Mars is frozen.
text_pp: At present though most of the water remaining on Mars is frozen

Text: If life exists at all on Mars, it is most likely to be located underground where liquid water can still exist.
text_pp: If life exists at all on Mars it is most likely to be located underground where liquid water can still exist

Text: [85] Conditions on the other terrestrial planets, Mercury and Venus, appear to be too harsh to support life as we know it.
text_pp: Conditions on the other terrestrial planets Mercury and Venus appear to be too harsh to support life as we know it

Text: But it has been conjectured that Europa, the fourth-largest moon of Jupiter, may possess a sub-surface ocean of liquid water and could potentially host life.
text_pp: But it has been conjectured that Europa the fourthlargest moon of Jupiter may possess a subsurface ocean of liquid water and could potentially host life

Text: [86] Astronomers have started to discover extrasolar Earth analogs – planets that lie in the habitable zone of space surrounding a star, and therefore could possibly host life as we know it.
text_pp: Astronomers have started to discover extrasolar Earth analogs planets that lie in the habitable zone of space surrounding a star and therefore could possibly host life as we know it

Text: [87] Media: Organizations: Philosophy:   Wikipedia (/ˌwɪkɪˈpiːdiə/ (listen) wik-ih-PEE-dee-ə or /ˌwɪki-/ (listen) wik-ee-) is a multilingual open-collaborative online encyclopedia created and maintained by a community of volunteer editors using a wiki-based editing system.
text_pp: Media Organizations Philosophy Wikipedia  listen wikihPEEdee or  listen wikee is a multilingual opencollaborative online encyclopedia created and maintained by a community of volunteer editors using a wikibased editing system

Text: It is one of the 15 most popular websites as ranked by Alexa, as of January 2021[update][3] and The Economist newspaper placed it as the "13th-most-visited place on the web".
text_pp: It is one of the most popular websites as ranked by Alexa as of Januaryupdate and The Economist newspaper placed it as the thmostvisited place on the web

Text: [4] Featuring no advertisements, it is hosted by the Wikimedia Foundation, an American non-profit organization funded primarily through donations.
text_pp: Featuring no advertisements it is hosted by the Wikimedia Foundation an American nonprofit organization funded primarily through donations

Text: Wikipedia was launched on January 15, 2001, by Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger.
text_pp: Wikipedia was launched on January   by Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger

Text: Sanger coined its name[5][6] as a portmanteau of "wiki" and "encyclopedia".
text_pp: Sanger coined its name as a portmanteau of wiki and encyclopedia

Text: It was initially an English-language encyclopedia, but versions in other languages were quickly developed.
text_pp: It was initially an Englishlanguage encyclopedia but versions in other languages were quickly developed

Text: With 6.2 million articles, the English Wikipedia is the largest of the 317 Wikipedia encyclopedias.
text_pp: With million articles the English Wikipedia is the largest of the Wikipedia encyclopedias

Text: Overall, Wikipedia comprises more than 55 million articles,[7] attracting 1.7 billion unique visitors per month.
text_pp: Overall Wikipedia comprises more than million articles attracting billion unique visitors per month

Text: [8][9] Wikipedia has been criticized for its uneven accuracy and for exhibiting systemic bias, including gender bias, with the majority of editors being male.
text_pp: Wikipedia has been criticized for its uneven accuracy and for exhibiting systemic bias including gender bias with the majority of editors being male

Text: [4] Edit-a-thons have been held to encourage female editors and increase the coverage of women's topics.
text_pp: Editathons have been held to encourage female editors and increase the coverage of women topics

Text: [10] In 2006, Time magazine stated that the open-door policy of allowing anyone to edit had made Wikipedia the biggest and possibly the best encyclopedia in the world, and was a testament to the vision of Jimmy Wales.
text_pp: In  Time magazine stated that the opendoor policy of allowing anyone to edit had made Wikipedia the biggest and possibly the best encyclopedia in the world and was a testament to the vision of Jimmy Wales

Text: [11] The project's reputation improved further in the 2010s as it increased efforts to improve its quality and reliability, based on its unique structure, curation and absence of commercial bias.
text_pp: The project reputation improved further in the s as it increased efforts to improve its quality and reliability based on its unique structure curation and absence of commercial bias

Text: [4] In 2018, Facebook and YouTube announced that they would help users detect fake news by suggesting links to related Wikipedia articles.
text_pp: In  Facebook and YouTube announced that they would help users detect fake news by suggesting links to related Wikipedia articles

Text: [12] Other collaborative online encyclopedias were attempted before Wikipedia, but none were as successful.
text_pp: Other collaborative online encyclopedias were attempted before Wikipedia but none were as successful

Text: [13] Wikipedia began as a complementary project for Nupedia, a free online English-language encyclopedia project whose articles were written by experts and reviewed under a formal process.
text_pp: Wikipedia began as a complementary project for Nupedia a free online Englishlanguage encyclopedia project whose articles were written by experts and reviewed under a formal process

Text: [14] It was founded on March 9, 2000, under the ownership of Bomis, a web portal company.
text_pp: It was founded on March   under the ownership of Bomis a web portal company

Text: Its main figures were Bomis CEO Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger, editor-in-chief for Nupedia and later Wikipedia.
text_pp: Its main figures were Bomis CEO Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger editorinchief for Nupedia and later Wikipedia

Text: [15][16] Nupedia was initially licensed under its own Nupedia Open Content License, but even before Wikipedia was founded, Nupedia switched to the GNU Free Documentation License at the urging of Richard Stallman.
text_pp: Nupedia was initially licensed under its own Nupedia Open Content License but even before Wikipedia was founded Nupedia switched to the GNU Free Documentation License at the urging of Richard Stallman

Text: [17] Wales is credited with defining the goal of making a publicly editable encyclopedia,[18][19] while Sanger is credited with the strategy of using a wiki to reach that goal.
text_pp: Wales is credited with defining the goal of making a publicly editable encyclopedia while Sanger is credited with the strategy of using a wiki to reach that goal

Text: [20] On January 10, 2001, Sanger proposed on the Nupedia mailing list to create a wiki as a "feeder" project for Nupedia.
text_pp: On January   Sanger proposed on the Nupedia mailing list to create a wiki as a feeder project for Nupedia

Text: [21] The domains wikipedia.com and wikipedia.org were registered on January 12, 2001,[22] and January 13, 2001,[23] respectively, and Wikipedia was launched on January 15, 2001,[14] as a single English-language edition at www.wikipedia.com,[24] and announced by Sanger on the Nupedia mailing list.
text_pp: The domains wikipediacom and wikipediaorg were registered on January   and January   respectively and Wikipedia was launched on January   as a single Englishlanguage edition at wwwwikipediacom and announced by Sanger on the Nupedia mailing list

Text: [48][49]  On January 18, 2012, the English Wikipedia participated in a series of coordinated protests against two proposed laws in the United States Congress—the Stop Online Piracy Act (SOPA) and the PROTECT IP Act (PIPA)—by blacking out its pages for 24 hours.

text_pp: More than million people viewed the blackout explanation page that temporarily replaced Wikipedia content

Text: [51][52] On January 20, 2014, Subodh Varma reporting for The Economic Times indicated that not only had Wikipedia's growth stalled, it "had lost nearly ten percent of its page views last year.
text_pp: On January   Subodh Varma reporting for The Economic Times indicated that not only had Wikipedia growth stalled it had lost nearly ten percent of its page views last year

Text: There was a decline of about two billion between December 2012 and December 2013.
text_pp: There was a decline of about two billion between December and December
