Text: "[53] By the end of December 2016, Wikipedia was ranked fifth in the most popular websites globally.
text_pp: By the end of December  Wikipedia was ranked fifth in the most popular websites globally

Text: [54] In January 2013, 274301 Wikipedia, an asteroid, was named after Wikipedia; in October 2014, Wikipedia was honored with the Wikipedia Monument; and, in July 2015, 106 of the 7,473 700-page volumes of Wikipedia became available as Print Wikipedia.
text_pp: In January  Wikipedia an asteroid was named after Wikipedia in October  Wikipedia was honored with the Wikipedia Monument and in July  of the  page volumes of Wikipedia became available as Print Wikipedia

Text: In April 2019, an Israeli lunar lander, Beresheet, crash landed on the surface of the Moon carrying a copy of nearly all of the English Wikipedia engraved on thin nickel plates; experts say the plates likely survived the crash.
text_pp: In April  an Israeli lunar lander Beresheet crash landed on the surface of the Moon carrying a copy of nearly all of the English Wikipedia engraved on thin nickel plates experts say the plates likely survived the crash

Text: [55][56] In June 2019, scientists reported that all 16 GB of article text from the English Wikipedia have been encoded into synthetic DNA.
text_pp: In June  scientists reported that all GB of article text from the English Wikipedia have been encoded into synthetic DNA

Text: [57] Unlike traditional encyclopedias, Wikipedia follows the procrastination principle[note 3] regarding the security of its content.
text_pp: Unlike traditional encyclopedias Wikipedia follows the procrastination principlenote  regarding the security of its content

Text: [60] It started almost entirely open—anyone could create articles, and any Wikipedia article could be edited by any reader, even those who did not have a Wikipedia account.
text_pp: It started almost entirely open could create articles and any Wikipedia article could be edited by any reader even those who did not have a Wikipedia account

Text: Modifications to all articles would be published immediately.
text_pp: Modifications to all articles would be published immediately

Text: As a result, any article could contain inaccuracies such as errors, ideological biases, and nonsensical or irrelevant text.
text_pp: As a result any article could contain inaccuracies such as errors ideological biases and nonsensical or irrelevant text

Text: Due to the increasing popularity of Wikipedia, some editions, including the English version, have introduced editing restrictions for certain cases.
text_pp: Due to the increasing popularity of Wikipedia some editions including the English version have introduced editing restrictions for certain cases

Text: For instance, on the English Wikipedia and some other language editions, only registered users may create a new article.
text_pp: For instance on the English Wikipedia and some other language editions only registered users may create a new article

Text: [61] On the English Wikipedia, among others, particularly controversial, sensitive or vandalism-prone pages have been protected to varying degrees.
text_pp: On the English Wikipedia among others particularly controversial sensitive or vandalismprone pages have been protected to varying degrees

Text: [62][63] A frequently vandalized article can be semi-protected or extended confirmed protected, meaning that only autoconfirmed or extended confirmed editors are able to modify it.
text_pp: A frequently vandalized article can be semiprotected or extended confirmed protected meaning that only autoconfirmed or extended confirmed editors are able to modify it

Text: [64] A particularly contentious article may be locked so that only administrators are able to make changes.
text_pp: A particularly contentious article may be locked so that only administrators are able to make changes

Text: [65] A 2021 article in the Columbia Journalism Review identified Wikipedia's page protection policies as "[p]erhaps the most important" means at Wikipedia's disposal to "regulate its market of ideas".
text_pp: A article in the Columbia Journalism Review identified Wikipedia page protection policies as perhaps the most important means at Wikipedia disposal to regulate its market of ideas

Text: [66] In certain cases, all editors are allowed to submit modifications, but review is required for some editors, depending on certain conditions.
text_pp: In certain cases all editors are allowed to submit modifications but review is required for some editors depending on certain conditions

Text: For example, the German Wikipedia maintains "stable versions" of articles,[67] which have passed certain reviews.
text_pp: For example the German Wikipedia maintains stable versions of articles which have passed certain reviews

Text: Following protracted trials and community discussion, the English Wikipedia introduced the "pending changes" system in December 2012.
text_pp: Following protracted trials and community discussion the English Wikipedia introduced the pending changes system in December

Text: [68] Under this system, new and unregistered users' edits to certain controversial or vandalism-prone articles are reviewed by established users before they are published.
text_pp: Under this system new and unregistered users edits to certain controversial or vandalismprone articles are reviewed by established users before they are published

Text: [69] Although changes are not systematically reviewed, the software that powers Wikipedia provides tools allowing anyone to review changes made by others.
text_pp: Although changes are not systematically reviewed the software that powers Wikipedia provides tools allowing anyone to review changes made by others

Text: The "History" page of each article links to each revision.
text_pp: The History page of each article links to each revision

Text: [note 4][70] On most articles, anyone can undo others' changes by clicking a link on the article's history page.
text_pp: note  On most articles anyone can undo others changes by clicking a link on the article history page

Text: Anyone can view the latest changes to articles, and anyone may maintain a "watchlist" of articles that interest them so they can be notified of any changes.
text_pp: Anyone can view the latest changes to articles and anyone may maintain a watchlist of articles that interest them so they can be notified of any changes

Text: "New pages patrol" is a process whereby newly created articles are checked for obvious problems.
text_pp: New pages patrol is a process whereby newly created articles are checked for obvious problems

Text: [71] In 2003, economics Ph.D. student Andrea Ciffolilli argued that the low transaction costs of participating in a wiki create a catalyst for collaborative development, and that features such as allowing easy access to past versions of a page favor "creative construction" over "creative destruction".
text_pp: In  economics PhD student Andrea Ciffolilli argued that the low transaction costs of participating in a wiki create a catalyst for collaborative development and that features such as allowing easy access to past versions of a page favor creative construction over creative destruction

Text: [72] Any change or edit that manipulates content in a way that purposefully compromises the integrity of Wikipedia is considered vandalism.
text_pp: Any change or edit that manipulates content in a way that purposefully compromises the integrity of Wikipedia is considered vandalism

Text: The most common and obvious types of vandalism include additions of obscenities and crude humor.
text_pp: The most common and obvious types of vandalism include additions of obscenities and crude humor

Text: Vandalism can also include advertising and other types of spam.
text_pp: Vandalism can also include advertising and other types of spam

Text: [73] Sometimes editors commit vandalism by removing content or entirely blanking a given page.
text_pp: Sometimes editors commit vandalism by removing content or entirely blanking a given page

Text: Less common types of vandalism, such as the deliberate addition of plausible but false information to an article can be more difficult to detect.
text_pp: Less common types of vandalism such as the deliberate addition of plausible but false information to an article can be more difficult to detect

Text: Vandals can introduce irrelevant formatting, modify page semantics such as the page's title or categorization, manipulate the underlying code of an article, or use images disruptively.
text_pp: Vandals can introduce irrelevant formatting modify page semantics such as the page title or categorization manipulate the underlying code of an article or use images disruptively

Text: [74] Obvious vandalism is generally easy to remove from Wikipedia articles; the median time to detect and fix vandalism is a few minutes.
text_pp: Obvious vandalism is generally easy to remove from Wikipedia articles the median time to detect and fix vandalism is a few minutes

Text: [75][76] However, some vandalism takes much longer to repair.
text_pp: However some vandalism takes much longer to repair

Text: [77] In the Seigenthaler biography incident, an anonymous editor introduced false information into the biography of American political figure John Seigenthaler in May 2005.
text_pp: In the Seigenthaler biography incident an anonymous editor introduced false information into the biography of American political figure John Seigenthaler in May

Text: Seigenthaler was falsely presented as a suspect in the assassination of John F.
text_pp: Seigenthaler was falsely presented as a suspect in the assassination of John F

Text: Kennedy.
text_pp: Kennedy

Text: [77] The article remained uncorrected for four months.
text_pp: The article remained uncorrected for four months

Text: [77] Seigenthaler, the founding editorial director of USA Today and founder of the Freedom Forum First Amendment Center at Vanderbilt University, called Wikipedia co-founder Jimmy Wales and asked whether he had any way of knowing who contributed the misinformation.
text_pp: Seigenthaler the founding editorial director of USA Today and founder of the Freedom Forum First Amendment Center at Vanderbilt University called Wikipedia cofounder Jimmy Wales and asked whether he had any way of knowing who contributed the misinformation

Text: Wales replied that he did not, although the perpetrator was eventually traced.
text_pp: Wales replied that he did not although the perpetrator was eventually traced

Text: [78][79] After the incident, Seigenthaler described Wikipedia as "a flawed and irresponsible research tool".
text_pp: After the incident Seigenthaler described Wikipedia as a flawed and irresponsible research tool

Text: [77] This incident led to policy changes at Wikipedia, specifically targeted at tightening up the verifiability of biographical articles of living people.
text_pp: This incident led to policy changes at Wikipedia specifically targeted at tightening up the verifiability of biographical articles of living people

Text: [80] In 2010, Daniel Tosh encouraged viewers of his show, Tosh.0, to visit the show's Wikipedia article and edit it at will.
text_pp: In  Daniel Tosh encouraged viewers of his show Tosh to visit the show Wikipedia article and edit it at will

Text: On a later episode, he commented on the edits to the article, most of them offensive, which had been made by the audience and had prompted the article to be locked from editing.
text_pp: On a later episode he commented on the edits to the article most of them offensive which had been made by the audience and had prompted the article to be locked from editing

Text: [81][82] Wikipedians often have disputes regarding content, which may result in repeatedly making opposite changes to an article, known as "edit warring".
text_pp: Wikipedians often have disputes regarding content which may result in repeatedly making opposite changes to an article known as edit warring

Text: [83][84] The process is widely seen as a resource-consuming scenario where no useful knowledge is added.
text_pp: The process is widely seen as a resourceconsuming scenario where no useful knowledge is added

Text: [85] This practice is also criticized as creating a competitive,[86] conflict based[87] editing culture associated with traditional masculine gender roles,[88] which contributes to the gender bias on Wikipedia.
text_pp: This practice is also criticized as creating a competitive conflict based editing culture associated with traditional masculine gender roles which contributes to the gender bias on Wikipedia

Text: Special interest groups have engaged in edit wars to advance their own political interests.
text_pp: Special interest groups have engaged in edit wars to advance their own political interests

Text: Content in Wikipedia is subject to the laws (in particular, copyright laws) of the United States and of the US state of Virginia, where the majority of Wikipedia's servers are located.
text_pp: Content in Wikipedia is subject to the laws in particular copyright laws of the United States and of the US state of Virginia where the majority of Wikipedia servers are located

Text: Beyond legal matters, the editorial principles of Wikipedia are embodied in the "five pillars" and in numerous policies and guidelines intended to appropriately shape content.
text_pp: Beyond legal matters the editorial principles of Wikipedia are embodied in the five pillars and in numerous policies and guidelines intended to appropriately shape content

Text: Even these rules are stored in wiki form, and Wikipedia editors write and revise the website's policies and guidelines.
text_pp: Even these rules are stored in wiki form and Wikipedia editors write and revise the website policies and guidelines

Text: [89] Editors can enforce these rules by deleting or modifying non-compliant material.
text_pp: Editors can enforce these rules by deleting or modifying noncompliant material

Text: Originally, rules on the non-English editions of Wikipedia were based on a translation of the rules for the English Wikipedia.
text_pp: Originally rules on the nonEnglish editions of Wikipedia were based on a translation of the rules for the English Wikipedia

Text: They have since diverged to some extent.
text_pp: They have since diverged to some extent

Text: [67] According to the rules on the English Wikipedia, each entry in Wikipedia must be about a topic that is encyclopedic and is not a dictionary entry or dictionary-style.
text_pp: According to the rules on the English Wikipedia each entry in Wikipedia must be about a topic that is encyclopedic and is not a dictionary entry or dictionarystyle

Text: [90] A topic should also meet Wikipedia's standards of "notability",[91] which generally means that the topic must have been covered in mainstream media or major academic journal sources that are independent of the article's subject.
text_pp: A topic should also meet Wikipedia standards of notability which generally means that the topic must have been covered in mainstream media or major academic journal sources that are independent of the article subject

Text: Further, Wikipedia intends to convey only knowledge that is already established and recognized.
text_pp: Further Wikipedia intends to convey only knowledge that is already established and recognized

Text: [92] It must not present original research.
text_pp: It must not present original research

Text: A claim that is likely to be challenged requires a reference to a reliable source.
text_pp: A claim that is likely to be challenged requires a reference to a reliable source

Text: Among Wikipedia editors, this is often phrased as "verifiability, not truth" to express the idea that the readers, not the encyclopedia, are ultimately responsible for checking the truthfulness of the articles and making their own interpretations.
text_pp: Among Wikipedia editors this is often phrased as verifiability not truth to express the idea that the readers not the encyclopedia are ultimately responsible for checking the truthfulness of the articles and making their own interpretations

Text: [93] This can at times lead to the removal of information that, though valid, is not properly sourced.
text_pp: This can at times lead to the removal of information that though valid is not properly sourced

Text: [94] Finally, Wikipedia must not take sides.
text_pp: Finally Wikipedia must not take sides

Text: [95] All opinions and viewpoints, if attributable to external sources, must enjoy an appropriate share of coverage within an article.
text_pp: All opinions and viewpoints if attributable to external sources must enjoy an appropriate share of coverage within an article

Text: This is known as a neutral point of view (NPOV).
text_pp: This is known as a neutral point of view NPOV

Text: Wikipedia's initial anarchy integrated democratic and hierarchical elements over time.
text_pp: Wikipedia initial anarchy integrated democratic and hierarchical elements over time

Text: [96][97] An article is not considered to be owned by its creator or any other editor, nor by the subject of the article.
text_pp: An article is not considered to be owned by its creator or any other editor nor by the subject of the article

Text: [98] Editors in good standing in the community can run for one of many levels of volunteer stewardship: this begins with "administrator",[99][100] privileged users who can delete pages, prevent articles from being changed in case of vandalism or editorial disputes (setting protective measures on articles), and try to prevent certain people from editing.
text_pp: Editors in good standing in the community can run for one of many levels of volunteer stewardship this begins with administrator privileged users who can delete pages prevent articles from being changed in case of vandalism or editorial disputes setting protective measures on articles and try to prevent certain people from editing

Text: Despite the name, administrators are not supposed to enjoy any special privilege in decision-making; instead, their powers are mostly limited to making edits that have project-wide effects and thus are disallowed to ordinary editors, and to implement restrictions intended to prevent certain persons from making disruptive edits (such as vandalism).
text_pp: Despite the name administrators are not supposed to enjoy any special privilege in decisionmaking instead their powers are mostly limited to making edits that have projectwide effects and thus are disallowed to ordinary editors and to implement restrictions intended to prevent certain persons from making disruptive edits such as vandalism

Text: [101][102] Fewer editors become administrators than in years past, in part because the process of vetting potential Wikipedia administrators has become more rigorous.
text_pp: Fewer editors become administrators than in years past in part because the process of vetting potential Wikipedia administrators has become more rigorous

Text: [103] Bureaucrats name new administrators solely upon the recommendations from the community.
text_pp: Bureaucrats name new administrators solely upon the recommendations from the community

Text: Over time, Wikipedia has developed a semi-formal dispute resolution process to assist in such circumstances.
text_pp: Over time Wikipedia has developed a semiformal dispute resolution process to assist in such circumstances

Text: To determine community consensus, editors can raise issues at appropriate community forums,[note 5] or seek outside input through third opinion requests or by initiating a more general community discussion known as a "request for comment".
text_pp: To determine community consensus editors can raise issues at appropriate community forumsnote  or seek outside input through third opinion requests or by initiating a more general community discussion known as a request for comment

Text: The Arbitration Committee presides over the ultimate dispute resolution process.
text_pp: The Arbitration Committee presides over the ultimate dispute resolution process

Text: Although disputes usually arise from a disagreement between two opposing views on how an article should read, the Arbitration Committee explicitly refuses to directly rule on the specific view that should be adopted.
text_pp: Although disputes usually arise from a disagreement between two opposing views on how an article should read the Arbitration Committee explicitly refuses to directly rule on the specific view that should be adopted

Text: Statistical analyses suggest that the committee ignores the content of disputes and rather focuses on the way disputes are conducted,[104] functioning not so much to resolve disputes and make peace between conflicting editors, but to weed out problematic editors while allowing potentially productive editors back in to participate.
text_pp: Statistical analyses suggest that the committee ignores the content of disputes and rather focuses on the way disputes are conducted functioning not so much to resolve disputes and make peace between conflicting editors but to weed out problematic editors while allowing potentially productive editors back in to participate

Text: Therefore, the committee does not dictate the content of articles, although it sometimes condemns content changes when it deems the new content violates Wikipedia policies (for example, if the new content is considered biased).
text_pp: Therefore the committee does not dictate the content of articles although it sometimes condemns content changes when it deems the new content violates Wikipedia policies for example if the new content is considered biased

Text: Its remedies include cautions and probations (used in 63% of cases) and banning editors from articles (43%), subject matters (23%), or Wikipedia (16%).
text_pp: Its remedies include cautions and probations used in  of cases and banning editors from articles  subject matters  or Wikipedia

Text: Complete bans from Wikipedia are generally limited to instances of impersonation and anti-social behavior.
text_pp: Complete bans from Wikipedia are generally limited to instances of impersonation and antisocial behavior

Text: When conduct is not impersonation or anti-social, but rather anti-consensus or in violation of editing policies, remedies tend to be limited to warnings.
text_pp: When conduct is not impersonation or antisocial but rather anticonsensus or in violation of editing policies remedies tend to be limited to warnings

Text: [105] Each article and each user of Wikipedia has an associated "Talk" page.
text_pp: Each article and each user of Wikipedia has an associated Talk page

Text: These form the primary communication channel for editors to discuss, coordinate and debate.
text_pp: These form the primary communication channel for editors to discuss coordinate and debate

Text: [106] Wikipedia's community has been described as cultlike,[107] although not always with entirely negative connotations.
text_pp: Wikipedia community has been described as cultlike although not always with entirely negative connotations

Text: [108] The project's preference for cohesiveness, even if it requires compromise that includes disregard of credentials, has been referred to as "anti-elitism".
text_pp: The project preference for cohesiveness even if it requires compromise that includes disregard of credentials has been referred to as antielitism

Text: [109] Wikipedians sometimes award one another virtual barnstars for good work.
text_pp: Wikipedians sometimes award one another virtual barnstars for good work

Text: These personalized tokens of appreciation reveal a wide range of valued work extending far beyond simple editing to include social support, administrative actions, and types of articulation work.
text_pp: These personalized tokens of appreciation reveal a wide range of valued work extending far beyond simple editing to include social support administrative actions and types of articulation work

Text: [110] Wikipedia does not require that its editors and contributors provide identification.
text_pp: Wikipedia does not require that its editors and contributors provide identification

Text: [111] As Wikipedia grew, "Who writes Wikipedia?"

Text: [193] Wikipedia seeks to create a summary of all human knowledge in the form of an online encyclopedia, with each topic covered encyclopedically in one article.

Text: When the project was started in 2001, all text in Wikipedia was covered by the GNU Free Documentation License (GFDL), a copyleft license permitting the redistribution, creation of derivative works, and commercial use of content while authors retain copyright of their work.
text_pp: When the project was started in  all text in Wikipedia was covered by the GNU Free Documentation License GFDL a copyleft license permitting the redistribution creation of derivative works and commercial use of content while authors retain copyright of their work

Text: [262] The GFDL was created for software manuals that come with free software programs licensed under the GPL.
text_pp: The GFDL was created for software manuals that come with free software programs licensed under the GPL

Text: This made it a poor choice for a general reference work: for example, the GFDL requires the reprints of materials from Wikipedia to come with a full copy of the GFDL text.
text_pp: This made it a poor choice for a general reference work for example the GFDL requires the reprints of materials from Wikipedia to come with a full copy of the GFDL text

Text: In December 2002, the Creative Commons license was released: it was specifically designed for creative works in general, not just for software manuals.
text_pp: In December  the Creative Commons license was released it was specifically designed for creative works in general not just for software manuals

Text: The license gained popularity among bloggers and others distributing creative works on the Web.
text_pp: The license gained popularity among bloggers and others distributing creative works on the Web

Text: The Wikipedia project sought the switch to the Creative Commons.
text_pp: The Wikipedia project sought the switch to the Creative Commons

Text: [263] Because the two licenses, GFDL and Creative Commons, were incompatible, in November 2008, following the request of the project, the Free Software Foundation (FSF) released a new version of the GFDL designed specifically to allow Wikipedia to relicense its content to CC BY-SA by August 1, 2009.

Text: "[323] In a 2017 opinion piece for Wired, Hossein Derakhshan describes Wikipedia as "one of the last remaining pillars of the open and decentralized web" and contrasted its existence as a text-based source of knowledge with social media and social networking services, the latter having "since colonized the web for television's values".

Text: For Derakhshan, Wikipedia's goal as an encyclopedia represents the Age of Enlightenment tradition of rationality triumphing over emotions, a trend which he considers "endangered" due to the "gradual shift from a typographic culture to a photographic one, which in turn mean[s] a shift from rationality to emotions, exposition to entertainment".

Text: [365][366] Machine learning (ML) is the study of computer algorithms that improve automatically through experience.
text_pp: Machine learning ML is the study of computer algorithms that improve automatically through experience

Text: [1] It is seen as a part of artificial intelligence.
text_pp: It is seen as a part of artificial intelligence

Text: Machine learning algorithms build a model based on sample data, known as "training data", in order to make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed to do so.
text_pp: Machine learning algorithms build a model based on sample data known as training data in order to make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed to do so

Text: [2] Machine learning algorithms are used in a wide variety of applications, such as email filtering and computer vision, where it is difficult or unfeasible to develop conventional algorithms to perform the needed tasks.
text_pp: Machine learning algorithms are used in a wide variety of applications such as email filtering and computer vision where it is difficult or unfeasible to develop conventional algorithms to perform the needed tasks

Text: A subset of machine learning is closely related to computational statistics, which focuses on making predictions using computers; but not all machine learning is statistical learning.
text_pp: A subset of machine learning is closely related to computational statistics which focuses on making predictions using computers but not all machine learning is statistical learning

Text: The study of mathematical optimization delivers methods, theory and application domains to the field of machine learning.
text_pp: The study of mathematical optimization delivers methods theory and application domains to the field of machine learning

Text: Data mining is a related field of study, focusing on exploratory data analysis through unsupervised learning.
text_pp: Data mining is a related field of study focusing on exploratory data analysis through unsupervised learning

Text: [4][5] In its application across business problems, machine learning is also referred to as predictive analytics.
text_pp: In its application across business problems machine learning is also referred to as predictive analytics

Text: Machine learning involves computers discovering how they can perform tasks without being explicitly programmed to do so.
text_pp: Machine learning involves computers discovering how they can perform tasks without being explicitly programmed to do so

Text: It involves computers learning from data provided so that they carry out certain tasks.
text_pp: It involves computers learning from data provided so that they carry out certain tasks

Text: For simple tasks assigned to computers, it is possible to program algorithms telling the machine how to execute all steps required to solve the problem at hand; on the computer's part, no learning is needed.
text_pp: For simple tasks assigned to computers it is possible to program algorithms telling the machine how to execute all steps required to solve the problem at hand on the computer part no learning is needed

Text: For more advanced tasks, it can be challenging for a human to manually create the needed algorithms.
text_pp: For more advanced tasks it can be challenging for a human to manually create the needed algorithms

Text: In practice, it can turn out to be more effective to help the machine develop its own algorithm, rather than having human programmers specify every needed step.
text_pp: In practice it can turn out to be more effective to help the machine develop its own algorithm rather than having human programmers specify every needed step

Text: [6] The discipline of machine learning employs various approaches to teach computers to accomplish tasks where no fully satisfactory algorithm is available.
text_pp: The discipline of machine learning employs various approaches to teach computers to accomplish tasks where no fully satisfactory algorithm is available

Text: In cases where vast numbers of potential answers exist, one approach is to label some of the correct answers as valid.
text_pp: In cases where vast numbers of potential answers exist one approach is to label some of the correct answers as valid

Text: This can then be used as training data for the computer to improve the algorithm(s) it uses to determine correct answers.
text_pp: This can then be used as training data for the computer to improve the algorithms it uses to determine correct answers

Text: For example, to train a system for the task of digital character recognition, the MNIST dataset of handwritten digits has often been used.
text_pp: For example to train a system for the task of digital character recognition the MNIST dataset of handwritten digits has often been used

Text: [6] Machine learning approaches are traditionally divided into three broad categories, depending on the nature of the "signal" or "feedback" available to the learning system: Other approaches have been developed which don't fit neatly into this three-fold categorisation, and sometimes more than one is used by the same machine learning system.
text_pp: Machine learning approaches are traditionally divided into three broad categories depending on the nature of the signal or feedback available to the learning system Other approaches have been developed which don fit neatly into this threefold categorisation and sometimes more than one is used by the same machine learning system

Text: For example topic modeling, dimensionality reduction or meta learning.
text_pp: For example topic modeling dimensionality reduction or meta learning

Text: [7] As of 2020, deep learning has become the dominant approach for much ongoing work in the field of machine learning.
text_pp: As of  deep learning has become the dominant approach for much ongoing work in the field of machine learning

Text: [6] The term machine learning was coined in 1959 by Arthur Samuel, an American IBMer and pioneer in the field of computer gaming and artificial intelligence.
text_pp: The term machine learning was coined in by Arthur Samuel an American IBMer and pioneer in the field of computer gaming and artificial intelligence

Text: [8][9] A representative book of the machine learning research during the 1960s was the Nilsson's book on Learning Machines, dealing mostly with machine learning for pattern classification.
text_pp: A representative book of the machine learning research during the s was the Nilsson book on Learning Machines dealing mostly with machine learning for pattern classification

Text: [10] Interest related to pattern recognition continued into the 1970s, as described by Duda and Hart in 1973.
text_pp: Interest related to pattern recognition continued into the s as described by Duda and Hart in

Text: [11] In 1981 a report was given on using teaching strategies so that a neural network learns to recognize 40 characters (26 letters, 10 digits, and 4 special symbols) from a computer terminal.
text_pp: In a report was given on using teaching strategies so that a neural network learns to recognize characters  letters digits and special symbols from a computer terminal

Text: [12] Tom M. Mitchell provided a widely quoted, more formal definition of the algorithms studied in the machine learning field: "A computer program is said to learn from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P if its performance at tasks in T, as measured by P,  improves with experience E."[13] This definition of the tasks in which machine learning is concerned offers a fundamentally operational definition rather than defining the field in cognitive terms.
text_pp: Tom M Mitchell provided a widely quoted more formal definition of the algorithms studied in the machine learning field A computer program is said to learn from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P if its performance at tasks in T as measured by P improves with experience E This definition of the tasks in which machine learning is concerned offers a fundamentally operational definition rather than defining the field in cognitive terms

Text: This follows Alan Turing's proposal in his paper "Computing Machinery and Intelligence", in which the question "Can machines think?"
text_pp: This follows Alan Turing proposal in his paper Computing Machinery and Intelligence in which the question Can machines think

text_pp: is replaced with the question Can machines do what we as thinking entities can do

Text: [14] Modern day machine learning has two objectives, one is to classify data based on models which have been developed, the other purpose is to make predictions for future outcomes based on these models.
text_pp: Modern day machine learning has two objectives one is to classify data based on models which have been developed the other purpose is to make predictions for future outcomes based on these models

Text: A hypothetical algorithm specific to classifying data may use computer vision of moles coupled with supervised learning in order to train it to classify the cancerous moles.
text_pp: A hypothetical algorithm specific to classifying data may use computer vision of moles coupled with supervised learning in order to train it to classify the cancerous moles

Text: Where as, a machine learning algorithm for stock trading may inform the trader of future potential predictions.
text_pp: Where as a machine learning algorithm for stock trading may inform the trader of future potential predictions

Text: [15] As a scientific endeavor, machine learning grew out of the quest for artificial intelligence.
text_pp: As a scientific endeavor machine learning grew out of the quest for artificial intelligence

Text: In the early days of AI as an academic discipline, some researchers were interested in having machines learn from data.
text_pp: In the early days of AI as an academic discipline some researchers were interested in having machines learn from data

Text: They attempted to approach the problem with various symbolic methods, as well as what was then termed "neural networks"; these were mostly perceptrons and other models that were later found to be reinventions of the generalized linear models of statistics.
text_pp: They attempted to approach the problem with various symbolic methods as well as what was then termed neural networks these were mostly perceptrons and other models that were later found to be reinventions of the generalized linear models of statistics

Text: [18] Probabilistic reasoning was also employed, especially in automated medical diagnosis.
text_pp: Probabilistic reasoning was also employed especially in automated medical diagnosis

Text: [19]:488 However, an increasing emphasis on the logical, knowledge-based approach caused a rift between AI and machine learning.
text_pp: However an increasing emphasis on the logical knowledgebased approach caused a rift between AI and machine learning

Text: Probabilistic systems were plagued by theoretical and practical problems of data acquisition and representation.
text_pp: Probabilistic systems were plagued by theoretical and practical problems of data acquisition and representation

Text: [19]:488 By 1980, expert systems had come to dominate AI, and statistics was out of favor.
text_pp: By  expert systems had come to dominate AI and statistics was out of favor

Text: [20] Work on symbolic/knowledge-based learning did continue within AI, leading to inductive logic programming, but the more statistical line of research was now outside the field of AI proper, in pattern recognition and information retrieval.
text_pp: Work on symbolicknowledgebased learning did continue within AI leading to inductive logic programming but the more statistical line of research was now outside the field of AI proper in pattern recognition and information retrieval

Text: [19]:708–710; 755 Neural networks research had been abandoned by AI and computer science around the same time.
text_pp: Neural networks research had been abandoned by AI and computer science around the same time

Text: This line, too, was continued outside the AI/CS field, as "connectionism", by researchers from other disciplines including Hopfield, Rumelhart and Hinton.
text_pp: This line too was continued outside the AICS field as connectionism by researchers from other disciplines including Hopfield Rumelhart and Hinton

Text: Their main success came in the mid-1980s with the reinvention of backpropagation.
text_pp: Their main success came in the mids with the reinvention of backpropagation

Text: [19]:25 Machine learning (ML), reorganized as a separate field, started to flourish in the 1990s.
text_pp: Machine learning ML reorganized as a separate field started to flourish in the s

Text: The field changed its goal from achieving artificial intelligence to tackling solvable problems of a practical nature.
text_pp: The field changed its goal from achieving artificial intelligence to tackling solvable problems of a practical nature

Text: It shifted focus away from the symbolic approaches it had inherited from AI, and toward methods and models borrowed from statistics and probability theory.
text_pp: It shifted focus away from the symbolic approaches it had inherited from AI and toward methods and models borrowed from statistics and probability theory

Text: [20] As of 2020, many sources continue to assert that machine learning remains a subfield of AI.
text_pp: As of  many sources continue to assert that machine learning remains a subfield of AI

Text: [21][22][16] The main disagreement is whether all of ML is part of AI, as this would mean that anyone using ML could claim they are using AI.
text_pp: The main disagreement is whether all of ML is part of AI as this would mean that anyone using ML could claim they are using AI

Text: Others have the view that not all of ML is part of AI[23][24][25] where only an 'intelligent' subset of ML is part of AI.
text_pp: Others have the view that not all of ML is part of AI where only an subset of ML is part of AI

Text: [26] The question to what is the difference between ML and AI is answered by Judea Pearl in The Book of Why.
text_pp: The question to what is the difference between ML and AI is answered by Judea Pearl in The Book of Why

Text: [27] Accordingly ML learns and predicts based on passive observations, whereas AI implies an agent  interacting with the environment to learn and take actions that maximize its chance of successfully achieving its goals.
text_pp: Accordingly ML learns and predicts based on passive observations whereas AI implies an agent interacting with the environment to learn and take actions that maximize its chance of successfully achieving its goals

Text: [30] Machine learning and data mining often employ the same methods and overlap significantly, but while machine learning focuses on prediction, based on known properties learned from the training data, data mining focuses on the discovery of (previously) unknown properties in the data (this is the analysis step of knowledge discovery in databases).
text_pp: Machine learning and data mining often employ the same methods and overlap significantly but while machine learning focuses on prediction based on known properties learned from the training data mining focuses on the discovery of previously unknown properties in the data this is the analysis step of knowledge discovery in databases

Text: Data mining uses many machine learning methods, but with different goals; on the other hand, machine learning also employs data mining methods as "unsupervised learning" or as a preprocessing step to improve learner accuracy.
text_pp: Data mining uses many machine learning methods but with different goals on the other hand machine learning also employs data mining methods as unsupervised learning or as a preprocessing step to improve learner accuracy

Text: Much of the confusion between these two research communities (which do often have separate conferences and separate journals, ECML PKDD being a major exception) comes from the basic assumptions they work with: in machine learning, performance is usually evaluated with respect to the ability to reproduce known knowledge, while in knowledge discovery and data mining (KDD) the key task is the discovery of previously unknown knowledge.
text_pp: Much of the confusion between these two research communities which do often have separate conferences and separate journals ECML PKDD being a major exception comes from the basic assumptions they work with in machine learning performance is usually evaluated with respect to the ability to reproduce known knowledge while in knowledge discovery and data mining KDD the key task is the discovery of previously unknown knowledge

Text: Evaluated with respect to known knowledge, an uninformed (unsupervised) method will easily be outperformed by other supervised methods, while in a typical KDD task, supervised methods cannot be used due to the unavailability of training data.
text_pp: Evaluated with respect to known knowledge an uninformed unsupervised method will easily be outperformed by other supervised methods while in a typical KDD task supervised methods cannot be used due to the unavailability of training data

Text: Machine learning also has intimate ties to optimization: many learning problems are formulated as minimization of some loss function on a training set of examples.
text_pp: Machine learning also has intimate ties to optimization many learning problems are formulated as minimization of some loss function on a training set of examples

Text: Loss functions express the discrepancy between the predictions of the model being trained and the actual problem instances (for example, in classification, one wants to assign a label to instances, and models are trained to correctly predict the pre-assigned labels of a set of examples).
text_pp: Loss functions express the discrepancy between the predictions of the model being trained and the actual problem instances for example in classification one wants to assign a label to instances and models are trained to correctly predict the preassigned labels of a set of examples

Text: [31] The difference between optimization and machine learning arises from the goal of generalization: while optimization algorithms can minimize the loss on a training set, machine learning is concerned with minimizing the loss on unseen samples.
text_pp: The difference between optimization and machine learning arises from the goal of generalization while optimization algorithms can minimize the loss on a training set machine learning is concerned with minimizing the loss on unseen samples

Text: Characterizing the generalization of various learning algorithms is an active topic of current research, especially for deep learning algorithms.
text_pp: Characterizing the generalization of various learning algorithms is an active topic of current research especially for deep learning algorithms

Text: Machine learning and statistics are closely related fields in terms of methods, but distinct in their principal goal: statistics draws population inferences from a sample, while machine learning finds generalizable predictive patterns.
text_pp: Machine learning and statistics are closely related fields in terms of methods but distinct in their principal goal statistics draws population inferences from a sample while machine learning finds generalizable predictive patterns

Text: [32] According to Michael I. Jordan, the ideas of machine learning, from methodological principles to theoretical tools, have had a long pre-history in statistics.
text_pp: According to Michael I Jordan the ideas of machine learning from methodological principles to theoretical tools have had a long prehistory in statistics

Text: [33] He also suggested the term data science as a placeholder to call the overall field.
text_pp: He also suggested the term data science as a placeholder to call the overall field

Text: [33] Leo Breiman distinguished two statistical modeling paradigms: data model and algorithmic model,[34] wherein "algorithmic model" means more or less the machine learning algorithms like Random forest.
text_pp: Leo Breiman distinguished two statistical modeling paradigms data model and algorithmic model wherein algorithmic model means more or less the machine learning algorithms like Random forest

Text: Some statisticians have adopted methods from machine learning, leading to a combined field that they call statistical learning.
text_pp: Some statisticians have adopted methods from machine learning leading to a combined field that they call statistical learning

Text: [35] A core objective of a learner is to generalize from its experience.
text_pp: A core objective of a learner is to generalize from its experience

Text: [3][36] Generalization in this context is the ability of a learning machine to perform accurately on new, unseen examples/tasks after having experienced a learning data set.
text_pp: Generalization in this context is the ability of a learning machine to perform accurately on new unseen examplestasks after having experienced a learning data set

Text: The training examples come from some generally unknown probability distribution (considered representative of the space of occurrences) and the learner has to build a general model about this space that enables it to produce sufficiently accurate predictions in new cases.
text_pp: The training examples come from some generally unknown probability distribution considered representative of the space of occurrences and the learner has to build a general model about this space that enables it to produce sufficiently accurate predictions in new cases

Text: The computational analysis of machine learning algorithms and their performance is a branch of theoretical computer science known as computational learning theory.
text_pp: The computational analysis of machine learning algorithms and their performance is a branch of theoretical computer science known as computational learning theory

Text: Because training sets are finite and the future is uncertain, learning theory usually does not yield guarantees of the performance of algorithms.
text_pp: Because training sets are finite and the future is uncertain learning theory usually does not yield guarantees of the performance of algorithms

Text: Instead, probabilistic bounds on the performance are quite common.
text_pp: Instead probabilistic bounds on the performance are quite common

Text: The bias–variance decomposition is one way to quantify generalization error.
text_pp: The bias decomposition is one way to quantify generalization error

Text: For the best performance in the context of generalization, the complexity of the hypothesis should match the complexity of the function underlying the data.
text_pp: For the best performance in the context of generalization the complexity of the hypothesis should match the complexity of the function underlying the data

Text: If the hypothesis is less complex than the function, then the model has under fitted the data.
text_pp: If the hypothesis is less complex than the function then the model has under fitted the data

Text: If the complexity of the model is increased in response, then the training error decreases.
text_pp: If the complexity of the model is increased in response then the training error decreases

Text: But if the hypothesis is too complex, then the model is subject to overfitting and generalization will be poorer.
text_pp: But if the hypothesis is too complex then the model is subject to overfitting and generalization will be poorer

Text: [37] In addition to performance bounds, learning theorists study the time complexity and feasibility of learning.
text_pp: In addition to performance bounds learning theorists study the time complexity and feasibility of learning

Text: In computational learning theory, a computation is considered feasible if it can be done in polynomial time.
text_pp: In computational learning theory a computation is considered feasible if it can be done in polynomial time

Text: There are two kinds of time complexity results.
text_pp: There are two kinds of time complexity results

Text: Positive results show that a certain class of functions can be learned in polynomial time.
text_pp: Positive results show that a certain class of functions can be learned in polynomial time

Text: Negative results show that certain classes cannot be learned in polynomial time.
text_pp: Negative results show that certain classes cannot be learned in polynomial time

Text: The types of machine learning algorithms differ in their approach, the type of data they input and output, and the type of task or problem that they are intended to solve.
text_pp: The types of machine learning algorithms differ in their approach the type of data they input and output and the type of task or problem that they are intended to solve

Text: Supervised learning algorithms build a mathematical model of a set of data that contains both the inputs and the desired outputs.
text_pp: Supervised learning algorithms build a mathematical model of a set of data that contains both the inputs and the desired outputs

Text: [38] The data is known as training data, and consists of a set of training examples.
text_pp: The data is known as training data and consists of a set of training examples

Text: Each training example has one or more inputs and the desired output, also known as a supervisory signal.
text_pp: Each training example has one or more inputs and the desired output also known as a supervisory signal

Text: In the mathematical model, each training example is represented by an array or vector, sometimes called a feature vector, and the training data is represented by a matrix.
text_pp: In the mathematical model each training example is represented by an array or vector sometimes called a feature vector and the training data is represented by a matrix

Text: Through iterative optimization of an objective function, supervised learning algorithms learn a function that can be used to predict the output associated with new inputs.
text_pp: Through iterative optimization of an objective function supervised learning algorithms learn a function that can be used to predict the output associated with new inputs

Text: [39] An optimal function will allow the algorithm to correctly determine the output for inputs that were not a part of the training data.
text_pp: An optimal function will allow the algorithm to correctly determine the output for inputs that were not a part of the training data

Text: An algorithm that improves the accuracy of its outputs or predictions over time is said to have learned to perform that task.
text_pp: An algorithm that improves the accuracy of its outputs or predictions over time is said to have learned to perform that task

Text: [13] Types of supervised learning algorithms include active learning, classification and regression.
text_pp: Types of supervised learning algorithms include active learning classification and regression

Text: [40] Classification algorithms are used when the outputs are restricted to a limited set of values, and regression algorithms are used when the outputs may have any numerical value within a range.
text_pp: Classification algorithms are used when the outputs are restricted to a limited set of values and regression algorithms are used when the outputs may have any numerical value within a range

Text: As an example, for a classification algorithm that filters emails, the input would be an incoming email, and the output would be the name of the folder in which to file the email.
text_pp: As an example for a classification algorithm that filters emails the input would be an incoming email and the output would be the name of the folder in which to file the email

Text: Similarity learning is an area of supervised machine learning closely related to regression and classification, but the goal is to learn from examples using a similarity function that measures how similar or related two objects are.
text_pp: Similarity learning is an area of supervised machine learning closely related to regression and classification but the goal is to learn from examples using a similarity function that measures how similar or related two objects are

Text: It has applications in ranking, recommendation systems, visual identity tracking, face verification, and speaker verification.
text_pp: It has applications in ranking recommendation systems visual identity tracking face verification and speaker verification

Text: Unsupervised learning algorithms take a set of data that contains only inputs, and find structure in the data, like grouping or clustering of data points.
text_pp: Unsupervised learning algorithms take a set of data that contains only inputs and find structure in the data like grouping or clustering of data points

Text: The algorithms, therefore, learn from test data that has not been labeled, classified or categorized.
text_pp: The algorithms therefore learn from test data that has not been labeled classified or categorized

Text: Instead of responding to feedback, unsupervised learning algorithms identify commonalities in the data and react based on the presence or absence of such commonalities in each new piece of data.
text_pp: Instead of responding to feedback unsupervised learning algorithms identify commonalities in the data and react based on the presence or absence of such commonalities in each new piece of data

Text: A central application of unsupervised learning is in the field of density estimation in statistics, such as finding the probability density function.
text_pp: A central application of unsupervised learning is in the field of density estimation in statistics such as finding the probability density function

Text: [41] Though unsupervised learning encompasses other domains involving summarizing and explaining data features.
text_pp: Though unsupervised learning encompasses other domains involving summarizing and explaining data features

Text: Cluster analysis is the assignment of a set of observations into subsets (called clusters) so that observations within the same cluster are similar according to one or more predesignated criteria, while observations drawn from different clusters are dissimilar.
text_pp: Cluster analysis is the assignment of a set of observations into subsets called clusters so that observations within the same cluster are similar according to one or more predesignated criteria while observations drawn from different clusters are dissimilar

Text: Different clustering techniques make different assumptions on the structure of the data, often defined by some similarity metric and evaluated, for example, by internal compactness, or the similarity between members of the same cluster, and separation, the difference between clusters.
text_pp: Different clustering techniques make different assumptions on the structure of the data often defined by some similarity metric and evaluated for example by internal compactness or the similarity between members of the same cluster and separation the difference between clusters

Text: Other methods are based on estimated density and graph connectivity.
text_pp: Other methods are based on estimated density and graph connectivity

Text: Semi-supervised learning falls between unsupervised learning (without any labeled training data) and supervised learning (with completely labeled training data).
text_pp: Semisupervised learning falls between unsupervised learning without any labeled training data and supervised learning with completely labeled training data

Text: Some of the training examples are missing training labels,  yet many machine-learning researchers have found that unlabeled data, when used in conjunction with a small amount of labeled data, can produce a considerable improvement in learning accuracy.
text_pp: Some of the training examples are missing training labels yet many machinelearning researchers have found that unlabeled data when used in conjunction with a small amount of labeled data can produce a considerable improvement in learning accuracy

Text: In weakly supervised learning, the training labels are noisy, limited, or imprecise; however, these labels are often cheaper to obtain, resulting in larger effective training sets.
text_pp: In weakly supervised learning the training labels are noisy limited or imprecise however these labels are often cheaper to obtain resulting in larger effective training sets

Text: [42] Reinforcement learning is an area of machine learning concerned with how software agents ought to take actions in an environment so as to maximize some notion of cumulative reward.
text_pp: Reinforcement learning is an area of machine learning concerned with how software agents ought to take actions in an environment so as to maximize some notion of cumulative reward

Text: Due to its generality, the field is studied in many other disciplines, such as game theory, control theory, operations research, information theory, simulation-based optimization, multi-agent systems, swarm intelligence, statistics and genetic algorithms.
text_pp: Due to its generality the field is studied in many other disciplines such as game theory control theory operations research information theory simulationbased optimization multiagent systems swarm intelligence statistics and genetic algorithms

Text: In machine learning, the environment is typically represented as a Markov decision process (MDP).
text_pp: In machine learning the environment is typically represented as a Markov decision process MDP

Text: Many reinforcement learning algorithms use dynamic programming techniques.
text_pp: Many reinforcement learning algorithms use dynamic programming techniques

Text: [43] Reinforcement learning algorithms do not assume knowledge of an exact mathematical model of the MDP, and are used when exact models are infeasible.
text_pp: Reinforcement learning algorithms do not assume knowledge of an exact mathematical model of the MDP and are used when exact models are infeasible

Text: Reinforcement learning algorithms are used in autonomous vehicles or in learning to play a game against a human opponent.
text_pp: Reinforcement learning algorithms are used in autonomous vehicles or in learning to play a game against a human opponent

Text: Self-learning as a machine learning paradigm was introduced in 1982 along with a neural network capable of self-learning named crossbar adaptive array (CAA).
text_pp: Selflearning as a machine learning paradigm was introduced in along with a neural network capable of selflearning named crossbar adaptive array CAA

Text: [44] It is a learning with no external rewards and no external teacher advice.
text_pp: It is a learning with no external rewards and no external teacher advice

Text: The CAA self-learning algorithm computes, in a crossbar fashion, both decisions about actions and emotions (feelings) about consequence situations.
text_pp: The CAA selflearning algorithm computes in a crossbar fashion both decisions about actions and emotions feelings about consequence situations

Text: The system is driven by the interaction between cognition and emotion.
text_pp: The system is driven by the interaction between cognition and emotion

Text:
[45]
The self-learning algorithm updates a memory matrix W =||w(a,s)|| such that in each iteration executes the following machine learning routine: It is a system with only one input, situation s, and only one output, action (or behavior) a.
text_pp: The selflearning algorithm updates a memory matrix Was such that in each iteration executes the following machine learning routine It is a system with only one input situation s and only one output action or behavior a

Text: There is neither a separate reinforcement input nor an advice input from the environment.
text_pp: There is neither a separate reinforcement input nor an advice input from the environment

Text: The backpropagated value (secondary reinforcement) is the emotion toward the consequence situation.
text_pp: The backpropagated value secondary reinforcement is the emotion toward the consequence situation

Text: The CAA exists in two environments, one is the behavioral environment where it behaves, and the other is the genetic environment, wherefrom it initially and only once receives initial emotions about situations to be encountered in the behavioral environment.
text_pp: The CAA exists in two environments one is the behavioral environment where it behaves and the other is the genetic environment wherefrom it initially and only once receives initial emotions about situations to be encountered in the behavioral environment

Text: After receiving the genome (species) vector from the genetic environment, the CAA learns a goal-seeking behavior, in an environment that contains both desirable and undesirable situations.
text_pp: After receiving the genome species vector from the genetic environment the CAA learns a goalseeking behavior in an environment that contains both desirable and undesirable situations

Text: [46] Several learning algorithms aim at discovering better representations of the inputs provided during training.
text_pp: Several learning algorithms aim at discovering better representations of the inputs provided during training

Text: [47] Classic examples include principal components analysis and cluster analysis.
text_pp: Classic examples include principal components analysis and cluster analysis

Text: Feature learning algorithms, also called representation learning algorithms, often attempt to preserve the information in their input but also transform it in a way that makes it useful, often as a pre-processing step before performing classification or predictions.
text_pp: Feature learning algorithms also called representation learning algorithms often attempt to preserve the information in their input but also transform it in a way that makes it useful often as a preprocessing step before performing classification or predictions

Text: This technique allows reconstruction of the inputs coming from the unknown data-generating distribution, while not being necessarily faithful to configurations that are implausible under that distribution.
text_pp: This technique allows reconstruction of the inputs coming from the unknown datagenerating distribution while not being necessarily faithful to configurations that are implausible under that distribution

Text: This replaces manual feature engineering, and allows a machine to both learn the features and use them to perform a specific task.
text_pp: This replaces manual feature engineering and allows a machine to both learn the features and use them to perform a specific task

Text: Feature learning can be either supervised or unsupervised.
text_pp: Feature learning can be either supervised or unsupervised

Text: In supervised feature learning, features are learned using labeled input data.
text_pp: In supervised feature learning features are learned using labeled input data

Text: Examples include artificial neural networks, multilayer perceptrons, and supervised dictionary learning.
text_pp: Examples include artificial neural networks multilayer perceptrons and supervised dictionary learning

Text: In unsupervised feature learning, features are learned with unlabeled input data.
text_pp: In unsupervised feature learning features are learned with unlabeled input data

Text: Examples include dictionary learning, independent component analysis, autoencoders, matrix factorization[48] and various forms of clustering.
text_pp: Examples include dictionary learning independent component analysis autoencoders matrix factorization and various forms of clustering

Text: [49][50][51] Manifold learning algorithms attempt to do so under the constraint that the learned representation is low-dimensional.
text_pp: Manifold learning algorithms attempt to do so under the constraint that the learned representation is lowdimensional

Text: Sparse coding algorithms attempt to do so under the constraint that the learned representation is sparse, meaning that the mathematical model has many zeros.
text_pp: Sparse coding algorithms attempt to do so under the constraint that the learned representation is sparse meaning that the mathematical model has many zeros

Text: Multilinear subspace learning algorithms aim to learn low-dimensional representations directly from tensor representations for multidimensional data, without reshaping them into higher-dimensional vectors.
text_pp: Multilinear subspace learning algorithms aim to learn lowdimensional representations directly from tensor representations for multidimensional data without reshaping them into higherdimensional vectors

Text: [52] Deep learning algorithms discover multiple levels of representation, or a hierarchy of features, with higher-level, more abstract features defined in terms of (or generating) lower-level features.
text_pp: Deep learning algorithms discover multiple levels of representation or a hierarchy of features with higherlevel more abstract features defined in terms of or generating lowerlevel features

Text: It has been argued that an intelligent machine is one that learns a representation that disentangles the underlying factors of variation that explain the observed data.
text_pp: It has been argued that an intelligent machine is one that learns a representation that disentangles the underlying factors of variation that explain the observed data

Text: [53] Feature learning is motivated by the fact that machine learning tasks such as classification often require input that is mathematically and computationally convenient to process.
text_pp: Feature learning is motivated by the fact that machine learning tasks such as classification often require input that is mathematically and computationally convenient to process

Text: However, real-world data such as images, video, and sensory data has not yielded to attempts to algorithmically define specific features.
text_pp: However realworld data such as images video and sensory data has not yielded to attempts to algorithmically define specific features

Text: An alternative is to discover such features or representations thorough examination, without relying on explicit algorithms.
text_pp: An alternative is to discover such features or representations thorough examination without relying on explicit algorithms

Text: Sparse dictionary learning is a feature learning method where a training example is represented as a linear combination of basis functions, and is assumed to be a sparse matrix.
text_pp: Sparse dictionary learning is a feature learning method where a training example is represented as a linear combination of basis functions and is assumed to be a sparse matrix

Text: The method is strongly NP-hard and difficult to solve approximately.
text_pp: The method is strongly NPhard and difficult to solve approximately

Text: [54] A popular heuristic method for sparse dictionary learning is the K-SVD algorithm.
text_pp: A popular heuristic method for sparse dictionary learning is the KSVD algorithm

Text: Sparse dictionary learning has been applied in several contexts.
text_pp: Sparse dictionary learning has been applied in several contexts

Text: In classification, the problem is to determine the class to which a previously unseen training example belongs.
text_pp: In classification the problem is to determine the class to which a previously unseen training example belongs

Text: For a dictionary where each class has already been built, a new training example is associated with the class that is best sparsely represented by the corresponding dictionary.
text_pp: For a dictionary where each class has already been built a new training example is associated with the class that is best sparsely represented by the corresponding dictionary

Text: Sparse dictionary learning has also been applied in image de-noising.
text_pp: Sparse dictionary learning has also been applied in image denoising

Text: The key idea is that a clean image patch can be sparsely represented by an image dictionary, but the noise cannot.
text_pp: The key idea is that a clean image patch can be sparsely represented by an image dictionary but the noise cannot

Text: [55] In data mining, anomaly detection, also known as outlier detection, is the identification of rare items, events or observations which raise suspicions by differing significantly from the majority of the data.
text_pp: In data mining anomaly detection also known as outlier detection is the identification of rare items events or observations which raise suspicions by differing significantly from the majority of the data

Text: [56] Typically, the anomalous items represent an issue such as bank fraud, a structural defect, medical problems or errors in a text.
text_pp: Typically the anomalous items represent an issue such as bank fraud a structural defect medical problems or errors in a text

Text: Anomalies are referred to as outliers, novelties, noise, deviations and exceptions.
text_pp: Anomalies are referred to as outliers novelties noise deviations and exceptions

Text: [57] In particular, in the context of abuse and network intrusion detection, the interesting objects are often not rare objects, but unexpected bursts of inactivity.
text_pp: In particular in the context of abuse and network intrusion detection the interesting objects are often not rare objects but unexpected bursts of inactivity

Text: This pattern does not adhere to the common statistical definition of an outlier as a rare object, and many outlier detection methods (in particular, unsupervised algorithms) will fail on such data unless it has been aggregated appropriately.
text_pp: This pattern does not adhere to the common statistical definition of an outlier as a rare object and many outlier detection methods in particular unsupervised algorithms will fail on such data unless it has been aggregated appropriately

Text: Instead, a cluster analysis algorithm may be able to detect the micro-clusters formed by these patterns.
text_pp: Instead a cluster analysis algorithm may be able to detect the microclusters formed by these patterns

Text: [58] Three broad categories of anomaly detection techniques exist.
text_pp: Three broad categories of anomaly detection techniques exist

Text: [59] Unsupervised anomaly detection techniques detect anomalies in an unlabeled test data set under the assumption that the majority of the instances in the data set are normal, by looking for instances that seem to fit least to the remainder of the data set.
text_pp: Unsupervised anomaly detection techniques detect anomalies in an unlabeled test data set under the assumption that the majority of the instances in the data set are normal by looking for instances that seem to fit least to the remainder of the data set

Text: Supervised anomaly detection techniques require a data set that has been labeled as "normal" and "abnormal" and involves training a classifier (the key difference to many other statistical classification problems is the inherently unbalanced nature of outlier detection).
text_pp: Supervised anomaly detection techniques require a data set that has been labeled as normal and abnormal and involves training a classifier the key difference to many other statistical classification problems is the inherently unbalanced nature of outlier detection

Text: Semi-supervised anomaly detection techniques construct a model representing normal behavior from a given normal training data set and then test the likelihood of a test instance to be generated by the model.
text_pp: Semisupervised anomaly detection techniques construct a model representing normal behavior from a given normal training data set and then test the likelihood of a test instance to be generated by the model

Text: In developmental robotics, robot learning algorithms generate their own sequences of learning experiences, also known as a curriculum, to cumulatively acquire new skills through self-guided exploration and social interaction with humans.
text_pp: In developmental robotics robot learning algorithms generate their own sequences of learning experiences also known as a curriculum to cumulatively acquire new skills through selfguided exploration and social interaction with humans

Text: These robots use guidance mechanisms such as active learning, maturation, motor synergies and imitation.
text_pp: These robots use guidance mechanisms such as active learning maturation motor synergies and imitation

Text: Association rule learning is a rule-based machine learning method for discovering relationships between variables in large databases.
text_pp: Association rule learning is a rulebased machine learning method for discovering relationships between variables in large databases

Text: It is intended to identify strong rules discovered in databases using some measure of "interestingness".
text_pp: It is intended to identify strong rules discovered in databases using some measure of interestingness

Text: [60] Rule-based machine learning is a general term for any machine learning method that identifies, learns, or evolves "rules" to store, manipulate or apply knowledge.
text_pp: Rulebased machine learning is a general term for any machine learning method that identifies learns or evolves rules to store manipulate or apply knowledge

Text: The defining characteristic of a rule-based machine learning algorithm is the identification and utilization of a set of relational rules that collectively represent the knowledge captured by the system.
text_pp: The defining characteristic of a rulebased machine learning algorithm is the identification and utilization of a set of relational rules that collectively represent the knowledge captured by the system

Text: This is in contrast to other machine learning algorithms that commonly identify a singular model that can be universally applied to any instance in order to make a prediction.
text_pp: This is in contrast to other machine learning algorithms that commonly identify a singular model that can be universally applied to any instance in order to make a prediction

Text: [61] Rule-based machine learning approaches include learning classifier systems, association rule learning, and artificial immune systems.
text_pp: Rulebased machine learning approaches include learning classifier systems association rule learning and artificial immune systems

Text: Based on the concept of strong rules, Rakesh Agrawal, Tomasz Imieliński and Arun Swami introduced association rules for discovering regularities between products in large-scale transaction data recorded by point-of-sale (POS) systems in supermarkets.
text_pp: Based on the concept of strong rules Rakesh Agrawal Tomasz Imieli and Arun Swami introduced association rules for discovering regularities between products in largescale transaction data recorded by pointofsale POS systems in supermarkets
